story:
In an instant, I watched my brother lose everything that belonged to him.  Even the heavy rains could not prevent the intense heat and flames from leaving his home and truck blackened and condemned.  A small electrical fire that originated due to faulty circuitry in his garage quickly progressed through his entire home consuming everything in its path.  He lost everything from surfboards to his toothbrush.  The bottom of his motorcycle riding boots laid melted on the floor of the garage.  Thousands of dollars worth in tools that he'd collected from my father over the years were warped and encased in a melted Craftsman on a shelf.  Sofa springs, blackened bed sheets and soot-encased clothing were all that remained upstairs.  It was a truly heartbreaking night to see my brother's world disappear into a stream of jet black smoke.  It is my goal to help begin the process of seeing my brother rebuild his home and his life.  I am asking for any help that you may be able to lend in this time of need.  I would really like for him to start of the New Year with a good outlook and the ability to begin the long road of reconstruction.  I am not setting an outrageous goal for this particular campaign and am really just looking forward to helping him hit the ground running without having to spend too much time looking back.  Thanks in advance for any of you who have taken the time to look over this campaign and even more thanks if you found the resources to help someone who just lost nearly all of theirs.  

 

***UPDATE: We had a family dinner for my Dad's birthday the other night and Will over and over expressed his heart felt thanks to everyone involved.  He has really been touched by the community both through this campaign and through others who have reached out to him.  I just wanted everyone to know how much he appreciates what has been accomplished here and I will keep you all updated as to his progress as things move along.

http://www.santacruzsentinel.com/capitola/ci_22107618/capitola-fire-engulfs-duplex-41st-avenue

 

Sincerely,

Chris Bernardi

Bernardi.Christopher@gmail.com

story:
The Lodge

Charit Creek is one of five backcountry lodges in the country that cannot be reached by car.  We feel fortunate to have this awe-inspiring place here in Tennessee's back yard. Adding to its uniqueness is that it is located in the heart of Big South Fork, one of the few National Recreational Areas administered by the National Park Service.  Big South Fork was developed to provide a wide range of recreational activities such as hiking, biking, horseback riding, paddling and hunting.  This attracts a diverse group of visitors to the lodge.  

As concessionaire's J Moore & Gregg White's friendship developed sharing a passion for hiking and backpacking.  We sought out his opportunity to share our enthusiasm for the outdoors, while preserving this local natural resource.  

Contributors to our cause will help us to overcome the challenges inherently related to operating a remote backcountry lodge.  Charit Creek Lodge is 100% off the grid and its buildings are listed on the National Historic Register.  The remoteness creates logistical challenges we often take for granted at home.  Your support is key to our success in improving and upgrading the lodge, its grounds and amenities we offer to our guests.

What We Need

We are raising these funds to assist us in improving the facilities and high level amenities to provide the ultimate guest experience.  Your support will be part of a larger investment to procure many of the following items in order from critical to long term:

Impact

There are multiple ways to purchase or donate to the lodge through one of our many perks, of which some are unique to this campaign.Your impact will be great, partnering with us to reach our goal.  All contributors will be listed on our website and at the lodge!

Risks & Challenges

Our obstacles are diverse and unique.  Much of the same that makes Charit Creek Lodge such a unique and serene place also creates its many challenges.  Being off the grid means all of our energy must be carted in from firewood for heat, propane for cooking, refrigeration and hot showers, to kerosene for lighting.  We operate our own well, pumping and treating the Lodge’s water supply.  Linen service is provided for our full service guests and must be laundered off-site.  Food service takes extra planning and preparation.  Sharing our message in the shadow of the Great Smokey National Park is a feat in itself.

We Have a Plan

As local Knoxville business owners’ we have experience in customer service, project & operations management and hospitality.  Our keen sense of business acumen allows us to create a strategy to mitigate our risks and find solutions to our challenges. 

Purchase a Perk

We have 11 unique perks to choose from...from merchandise to a trip to the lodge, or make a donation! We are grateful for your support!

Other Ways to Help!

Spread the word with your friends & family using your social media networks.

Volunteer! Email the lodge for volunteering opportunities!

Support Big South Fork

story:
Compass- A Holistic Approach to Travel

Greetings from Atlanta, Georgia! We are Christine and Carolyn, and we need help kick-starting our travel company: Compass. We created Compass with the intention of investing in a business through which we can invest in others. 

Compass seeks to combine adventure and travel with compassion and love for human kind. Compass’ off-the-beaten-path, intimate excursions will focus on culture, eco-awareness, and volunteering. Excursions will immerse individuals in the distinctive culture of each region through an exploration of local cuisine, markets, and historical sites. Travelers’ attention will be directed to each region’s unique biodiversity and conservation efforts through visits to national parks and wildlife refuges. Most importantly, a portion of each trip will be spent volunteering with small organizations that directly benefit the local community. Additionally, Compass will incorporate elements such as yoga, tai chi, photography, and philosophy for individuals seeking to deepen and enrich their travel experience further.

By contributing to this campaign, you are creating a future for a better world. In May, we will be traveling to Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam, and Indonesdia to build the foundation of our company by developing lifetime relationships with organizations and individuals we plan to work with in the future. 


15% of this campaign will be donated to Jimmy's Village School in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Jimmy established a school in August of 2011 to educate children living in villages of Cambodia.  Contributions made towards the school help support education for children ages 6-17 and help families of children attending the school receive aid in food and health care.  Every week the children from Jimmy's Village School ride their bicycles out into the more rural areas to distribute general lessons and educational materials to kids who cannot afford books or who do not have the opportunity to attend schools.  This year the school is trying to raise money for a copy machine to further the development of their school system and to help build an addition to the school in order to give more children the opportunity to learn.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/189594284440704/

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Jimmys-Cambodian-Dream/493236920703577

 

Contributions to this campaign will support our visit to Camp Leakey in Tanjung Puting National Park: Borneo, Indonesia. Camp Leakey, a part of the Orangutan Foundation (see below), is a wild life refuge and research facility that rehabilitates Orangutans affected by poaching and deforestation. Orangutans, one of the most intelligent species on earth, are considered critically endangered and are at extreme risk of going extinct. Bringing attention and tourism to the area helps preserve their habitat and keeps loggers and poachers out! 5% of funds will be donated to Camp Leaky:

http://orangutan.org/OFI/

http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g2301800-d1472508-Reviews-Camp_Leakey-Central_Kalimantan_Borneo.html

http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g2301800-d447297-Reviews-Tanjung_Puting_National_Park-Central_Kalimantan_Borneo.html


The remaining contributions will assist in our travel expenses and fund the completion of our website, youtube channel, and travel guide. In addition, funds will go towards the business legalities such as copyrights, incorporation, licenses, and insurance. 


Contributors will receive perks! Check out our perks on the right hand side of the page.


The Impact

Our objective is to bring about a positive change in each region of travel and to impact the lives of our travelers with the hope they will inspire others in efforts to make a difference in our world!

Contribute to a company that strives for altruism and positive action!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you love our campaign and are unable to contribute a donation please share our campaign through facebook and twitter!

story:
In Short

The objective of this campaign is to raise a small amount of funding for the only youth cycling team in northern Albania. The team is composed of a small group of extremely talented kids who love cycling and bicycle racing but, unfortunately, have little equipment and few resources with which to pursue their passion. You can help by providing small monetary contributions, or donating your old cycling GPS unit or cycling computer.

My Pitch...

Right... A campaign aimed at raising funds for a youth cycling team in an obscure city in northern Albania? I know, to many of you this may seem to be coming from way outside of left-field, so let me explain myself a bit.

My name is William Hunter, I'm a native of the Carolina's in the good 'ole US of A, a former competitive road cyclist, and now a Peace Corps Volunteer serving in the small, mountainous nation of Albania. I love everything to do with bicycles, from road racing to mountain biking, commuting to critical masses, to simply repairing old, beat-up steal frames. However, I also love traveling, volunteering, and exploring new cultures, and when I accepted my invitation to serve for two years as a volunteer in Albania I did so with the expectation that I might need to put my passion for cycling on hold for a while. Albania, after all, is still a developing nation, and though it lies only a few hours from no less a bicycle crazed nation than Italy, cycling for pleasure is still foreign concepts to most Albanians. 

My first few months in Albania seemed to confirm my suspicions; cycling, and outdoor recreation in general, is just not very popular here. To most, the idea of touring the nation by bicycle seems as impossible a task as traveling to the moon and back. This was fine by me though. I had my own bicycle and could still enjoy my passion, even if I had to do it alone. But then something strange happened - after a while I began to hear rumors of a city far to the northwest where it was said that everyone owned a bicycle. In fact, people often refered to this city as "Qyteti i Biçikleteve," or in Englsih, "The City of Bicycles." 

The city's name is Shkodër, and after a bit of research on it's bicycle culture I came to realize that Shkodër has a long and interesting history as the first Balkan city to embrace two wheeled travel. (Below are two links which expound a bit on this history) 

http://velo-city2013.com/?page_id=2337&project_id=42
http://2lovecycling.com/2013/11/22/shkodra-bicycle-city/

Fantastic, so a city with such a storied and interesting connection with bicycles is bound to have a top notch cycling team? Right? A team which is the pride of the city, the crown jewel (as far as cycling culture is concerned) of the Balkan Peninsula - right?

Wrong.

 I'll spare you the details of my travel to Shkodër and my first few weeks there, but suffice it to say I did not find the rigorously trained, well equipped, and panache endowed cycling team I had expected. Instead, after asking around for a few days, I was led to the Vllaznia Futbol Stadium and Sports Club. There, in what amounted to a storage shed behind the stadium, I was introduced to the seven members of the Vllaznia Youth Cycling Team. 

They are young: not one of them over the age of 16.

They ride a mishmash of steel and aluminum framed bicycle from the 80's and 90's which have been wrecked and repaired so many times that often one cannot tell what brand they were originally.

Their kits are similarly worn; all of them having been charity hand-me-downs from Italy or England, and most are two or more sizes too large for their owners.

Their helmets are worn simply for aesthetic purposes; their heroes in the grand tours wear helmets, so they do to, even if the only helmets they own are cracked in half and no longer offer any sort of protection.

But let me tell you, these kids are talented. They possess a drive and passion unrivaled by youth cyclists I have met in the United States. Furthermore, had they been born in the United States, I am certain that a number of them would have already been picked up by a development team. They are that good.
So good, in fact, that after just a few rides with them I knew that I needed I was to make it my mission as a Peace Corps Volunteer to try and help these kids through any means at my disposal.

The Goal

The goal of this project is, in my opinion, rather modest. We are simply trying to raise the funds required to design and purchase ten or so custom cycling kits and a few cycling GPS units. These young cyclists represent a city which doesn’t even know they exist, and this is pretty unsurprising, seeing as how a rag-tag group of kids in worn out spandex does not elicit much attention from the general public, let alone any feelings of town pride. But a polished peloton in well fitting, matching kits bearing the all too well known title Vllaznia on their backs would almost certainly turn heads. If this were the reality then maybe Albania’s famed city of bicycles would begin to recognize the talented youth it has fostered, and then maybe the people of Shkodër would begin to place more importance on supporting the team themselves with funding for new bicycles, travel expenses, training equipment, etc. These kids have the talent, all they are lacking is recognition…


What You Get If You Donate

Being a Peace Corps volunteer, I am not really in any position to offer any fantastic rewards for those who pledge large sums of money to this cause. I can however, provide the following:

  • A signed thank-you letter from myself, the Vllaznia cycling coach, and the team, with an enclosed photo to those who pledge $50 or more. 
  • I can add eight sponsor logos to the kits we will have designed for the team, so I am offering these those who donate $200 or more. First come first serve.
  • And of course, no mater what size donation you give, you can take pleasure in the fact that you are not only helping to promote the beautiful sport of cycling in a nation where it has yet to make serious inroads, but also helping to make the dreams of seven boys from a developing nation a reality.


Other Ways To Help: Donate Your Old GPS Unit

Would you like to help but are unable to contribute monetary assistance? No problem. In addition to raising money to pay for team kits, race registration fees, and travel expenses, etc., another goal is to provide the team with some sort of GPS cyclocomputer system. If you would like to donate any used handheld GPS devices, be they from Garmin's cycling specific line or otherwise, we would happily receive them.

They can be any make or model, as long as one can purchase a cycling mount for them and they are still in working order. Like I said, they don't need to be cycling specific. I use a Garmin E-Trex 30, and it performs just fine...

These donations can be shipped to this address in the United States:

Sandra Hunter

534 Brush Creek Rd.,

Fairview, NC, 28730


The Team
story_txt:
In Short
The objective of this campaign is to raise a small amount of funding for the only youth cycling team in northern Albania. The team is composed of a small group of extremely talented kids who love cycling and bicycle racing but, unfortunately, have little equipment and few resources with which to pursue their passion. You can help by providing small monetary contributions, or donating your old cycling GPS unit or cycling computer.
My Pitch...
Right... A campaign aimed at raising funds for a youth cycling team in an obscure city in northern Albania? I know, to many of you this may seem to be coming from way outside of left-field, so let me explain myself a bit.

My name is William Hunter, I'm a native of the Carolina's in the good 'ole US of A, a former competitive road cyclist, and now a Peace Corps Volunteer serving in the small, mountainous nation of Albania. I love everything to do with bicycles, from road racing to mountain biking, commuting to critical masses, to simply repairing old, beat-up steal frames. However, I also love traveling, volunteering, and exploring new cultures, and when I accepted my invitation to serve for two years as a volunteer in Albania I did so with the expectation that I might need to put my passion for cycling on hold for a while. Albania, after all, is still a developing nation, and though it lies only a few hours from no less a bicycle crazed nation than Italy, cycling for pleasure is still foreign concepts to most Albanians. 

My first few months in Albania seemed to confirm my suspicions; cycling, and outdoor recreation in general, is just not very popular here. To most, the idea of touring the nation by bicycle seems as impossible a task as traveling to the moon and back. This was fine by me though. I had my own bicycle and could still enjoy my passion, even if I had to do it alone. But then something strange happened - after a while I began to hear rumors of a city far to the northwest where it was said that everyone owned a bicycle. In fact, people often refered to this city as "Qyteti i Biçikleteve," or in Englsih, "The City of Bicycles." 


The city's name is Shkodër, and after a bit of research on it's bicycle culture I came to realize that Shkodër has a long and interesting history as the first Balkan city to embrace two wheeled travel. (Below are two links which expound a bit on this history) 

http://velo-city2013.com/?page_id=2337&project_id=42

http://2lovecycling.com/2013/11/22/shkodra-bicycle-city/


Fantastic, so a city with such a storied and interesting connection with bicycles is bound to have a top notch cycling team? Right? A team which is the pride of the city, the crown jewel (as far as cycling culture is concerned) of the Balkan Peninsula - right?

Wrong.

 I'll spare you the details of my travel to Shkodër and my first few weeks there, but suffice it to say I did not find the rigorously trained, well equipped, and panache endowed cycling team I had expected. Instead, after asking around for a few days, I was led to the Vllaznia Futbol Stadium and Sports Club. There, in what amounted to a storage shed behind the stadium, I was introduced to the seven members of the Vllaznia Youth Cycling Team. 

They are young: not one of them over the age of 16.

They ride a mishmash of steel and aluminum framed bicycle from the 80's and 90's which have been wrecked and repaired so many times that often one cannot tell what brand they were originally.

Their kits are similarly worn; all of them having been charity hand-me-downs from Italy or England, and most are two or more sizes too large for their owners.

Their helmets are worn simply for aesthetic purposes; their heroes in the grand tours wear helmets, so they do to, even if the only helmets they own are cracked in half and no longer offer any sort of protection.

But let me tell you, these kids are talented. They possess a drive and passion unrivaled by youth cyclists I have met in the United States. Furthermore, had they been born in the United States, I am certain that a number of them would have already been picked up by a development team. They are that good.

So good, in fact, that after just a few rides with them I knew that I needed I was to make it my mission as a Peace Corps Volunteer to try and help these kids through any means at my disposal.


The Goal
The goal of this project is, in my opinion, rather modest. We are simply trying to raise the funds required to design and purchase ten or so custom cycling kits and a few cycling GPS units. These young cyclists represent a city which doesn’t even know they exist, and this is pretty unsurprising, seeing as how a rag-tag group of kids in worn out spandex does not elicit much attention from the general public, let alone any feelings of town pride. But a polished peloton in well fitting, matching kits bearing the all too well known title Vllaznia on their backs would almost certainly turn heads. If this were the reality then maybe Albania’s famed city of bicycles would begin to recognize the talented youth it has fostered, and then maybe the people of Shkodër would begin to place more importance on supporting the team themselves with funding for new bicycles, travel expenses, training equipment, etc. These kids have the talent, all they are lacking is recognition…


What You Get If You Donate

    Being a Peace Corps volunteer, I am not really in any position to offer any fantastic rewards for those who pledge large sums of money to this cause. I can however, provide the following:


A signed thank-you letter from myself, the Vllaznia cycling coach, and the team, with an enclosed photo to those who pledge $50 or more. 
I can add eight sponsor logos to the kits we will have designed for the team, so I am offering these those who donate $200 or more. First come first serve.
And of course, no mater what size donation you give, you can take pleasure in the fact that you are not only helping to promote the beautiful sport of cycling in a nation where it has yet to make serious inroads, but also helping to make the dreams of seven boys from a developing nation a reality.

 Other Ways To Help: Donate Your Old GPS Unit Would you like to help but are unable to contribute monetary assistance? No problem. In addition to raising money to pay for team kits, race registration fees, and travel expenses, etc., another goal is to provide the team with some sort of GPS cyclocomputer system. If you would like to donate any used handheld GPS devices, be they from Garmin's cycling specific line or otherwise, we would happily receive them.
They can be any make or model, as long as one can purchase a cycling mount for them and they are still in working order. Like I said, they don't need to be cycling specific. I use a Garmin E-Trex 30, and it performs just fine...
These donations can be shipped to this address in the United States:
Sandra Hunter
534 Brush Creek Rd.,
Fairview, NC, 28730


The Team

story:
Imagine a frontier where your spirit soars with the endless sky and your heart leaps with the sound of horses galloping across the range. Recharge by leaving behind your deadlines, demands and devices. Relax as you settle in to a retreat, full of adventure and comfort, that happily welcomes you and your pet. 

Nirvana, right?

Welcome to Nirvana Ranch Bed & Barn.

True to Oregon's pioneering roots, we are creating a unique guest experience where mindfulness and sustainability intersect with your hunger for the open range. This oasis is Nirvana Ranch Bed & Barn, located in Central Oregon, land of sunshine and natural beauty.

At Nirvana Ranch, guests will experience soulful and meaningful connections with like-minded travelers who care deeply for the earth and all her creatures. We want you to be part of this wonderful and rare creation.

At Nirvana Ranch, guests will stay in Western Style "off the grid" Tiny Houses that are fully appointed with all necessary creature comforts. Visitors can have their morning coffee on the porch with their pets while enjoying the beautiful mountain views of the Three Sisters.

Guests will be nourished with meals that use fresh ingredients from our organic garden. Nirvana Ranch will offer many unique experiences such as: Customized trail rides with our rescued horses, singalongs by the campfire and educational talks on a variety of topics related to sustainable, mindful living. 

You've seen Nirvana in your dreams and you've felt it in your soul. Now, we invite you to join us in creating Nirvana Ranch Bed & Barn, right here on earth--for all to enjoy!

What We Need & What You Get

The beginnings of Nirvana Ranch already exist in Central Oregon. We have a beautiful site and a rental cabin, managed by co-founder Lori Slaughter. In just two years, she has earned 5-Star Host status on AirBnB. We are seeking $265,000 in start-up funds to allow Nirvana Ranch to realize its full potential.

1st Year Property Lease $12,000
Barn $75,000
Fencing $5,000
6 Horse Stock Trailer $18,000
Used Tack $2,000
Irrigation System $20,000
Pasture Refurbishment $2,000
Tiny Homes (2) $100,000
1st Year Farrier Service $1,350
Horse Adoption Fees (5 horses) $2,500
1st Year Horse Care $10,000
1st Year Insurances $2,500
Permits & Fees $10,000
Marketing $5,000
Special Gifts for Our Supporters

$50 – You'll be our friend for life!    

$100 – 1-hour lesson in horsemanship or a “How to Live Tiny” talk for 1 person (available for the first 100 supporters at this level)                                                          

$150 – 2-hour trail ride for 1 person (available for the first 75 supporters at this level)

$250 – A 1 night stay in a cabin for 2 people (available for the first 50 supporters at this level)

$500 - A 1 night stay in a cabin with a 2-hour trail ride for 2 people (available for the first 50 supporters at this level)

$750 – A 2 night stay in a cabin with a 2-hour trail ride for 2 people (available for the first 25 supporters at this level)

$1,000 – A 2 night stay in a cabin with a 2-hour trail ride plus Gourmet Package (Cabin stocked with fresh, organic ingredients for 2 meals) for 2 people (available for the first 10 supporters at this level)

$5,000 – Sponsor a rescue horse for 1 year. Get a 4 night stay in a cabin with a customized trail ride with your sponsored horse plus Gourmet Package (Cabin stocked with fresh, organic ingredients for 4 meals) for 2 people (available for the first 5 supporters at this level)

$10,000 – Put your name on a Nirvana Ranch tiny cabin!! Get a 7 night stay in your personal cabin with a customized trail ride plus Gourmet Package (Cabin stocked with fresh, organic ingredients for 7 meals) for 2 people (available for the first 2 supporters at this level)

We are 100% committed to making Nirvana Ranch Bed & Barn a success. If we don't reach our full goal, funds raised will be used, per the budget above, to move closer to our complete vision. 

The Impact

Nirvana Ranch will become a sustainable, ecotourism business that provides mindful travelers with:

  • A unique, pet-friendly destination featuring "Off The Grid" Tiny Home lodging
  • Customized trail rides through Central Oregon
  • Farm to table cuisine
  • Hands-on opportunities to learn about sustainable living & horsemanship
  • The good feelings that come with knowing their visit provides permanent homes to rescued horses & doesn't negatively impact the environment
Nothing like this is currently available in Central Oregon.

We are passionate about this project and know it will be attractive to travelers looking for vacation experiences that are more meaningful and purposeful than the traditional cookie-cutter resort. Co-owner Lori Slaughter has already been named a 5-Star Air BnB Hostess. The glowing reviews Lori has received from visitors reflect our commitment to meeting the unique needs of each Nirvana Ranch guest. Co-owner Sarah Stebbins has a track record of business success as a top management consultant with core competencies in leadership and change management. Our advisory group includes experts in marketing, alternative energy, organic gardening, farm-to-table cuisine, and Tiny Home building and living. We are all fully engaged and committed to making Nirvana Ranch a reality.
According to the Central Oregon Visitor's Association, this region is a highly-coveted travel destination, welcoming 3.8 million overnight visitors annually. The average stay for visitors to Central Oregon is 4.1 nights. In 2014, travel expenditures in Central Oregon topped $747 million. We know there is a high demand for ecotourist destinations that are pet friendly and provide memorable, customized adventures. Combined with the unique opportunity for mindful travelers to experience "off the grid" living in a Tiny House, Nirvana Ranch Bed & Barn will be a very attractive tourist destination in Central Oregon.
We believe in this vision that is Nirvana Ranch. Renew your spirit and become a "Founding Pardner" with us.

Addressing Risks & Challenges

All entrepreneurs and investors know of the inherent risks in launching a new venture. We are aware that the tourism industry ebbs and flows with fluctuations in the global economy. Should the economic climate shift in an unfavorable way for tourism, we plan to lease the cabins long term. Because of the competitive rental market in Central Oregon, this is a strong "Plan B."  Additionally, we would offer to the vibrant, local equestrian community, partial lease options on our horses and full boarding. This attractive alternative to full horse ownership would provide a steady revenue source for the business.

Our marketing plan is robust and scalable. It includes multiple target audiences - ecotourists, horse and pet enthusiasts and those interested in sustainable living, alternative energy and organic, local cuisine. Strong social media presence combined with partnerships with like-minded businesses and movements around the globe will be key factors in executing our marketing strategy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you know other people or companies who would love to be part of this exciting venture? If so, please share our site with them on Social Media. Just use the handy Social Share buttons right here on our site. And thank you!

story:
My roomie Dave said some know nothin' corncobs made like a cool million for 'tato salad on that Kickstarts crap. So stupid. Costs like 5 bucks. They probably didn't even put brats in it. Idiots. Kickstarts is such a load. They let that 'tato salad fly and took down my 'Maro campaign. 

Also saw a bunch of other crap on Kickstarts that nobody wants. NOBODY. So sad to see people beg for money to make garbage. That's why I'm designin' a 'Maro for babes to crave, 24/7, 365, open on Sundays. This isn't some crap idea for a snoozefest movie or a new banjo band album that can go straight in the trash. It's for a 'Maro. CUSTOM (Van Halen sticker).Fellas can enjoy it too, guy to guy. It's for everyone from coast to coast. Captain Karl knows how to share. All are welcome to have a peep and enjoy with 110% satisfaction.

Basically, I'd be cruisin' in this custom (Van Halen sticker) 'Maro for babes, the USA, and more babes. Givin' double middle freedom rockets out to idiots who think they're better than you or me. Really lettin' 'em know they can suck it. Especially my ex-wife, Ann.

Not sure if that amount's enough, but any extra $$$ would go to make it rock even harder. Might have to hit up my main man Guy Fieri for primo tips on customizaish?   Sky's pretty much the limit when Guy starts pilin' anything high with toppings. Could probably turn the whole trunk into a fridge for cold ones? So money. Man.

Guess I'm supposed to put down some risks here, so, "might get TOO many babes?" Ha!

United we rock, with the heat of a thousand suns, you guys.

-Karl "K-Money" Welzein

story:
Introducing The VEER 18L Packable Bag With Inflatable Back Panel and Camera Cube

The VEER 18L pack is the first packable bag with an inflatable back panel and inflatable camera cube, giving you the right balance between having enough bag and keeping it minimal – whether you’re a photographer… or not.

story:
WELCOME TO THE LODGE!

The Fly Fishing Lodge for Wounded Warriors was established by U.S. Military Veterans as a fly fishing haven for their fellow Veterans returning from the battlefield with traumatic injuries.  

From home base at our lodge on the Missouri River, we create an outdoor rehabilitation center for our returning service members.  We've had some up and put them up at hotels, but we want to create a place of community where we can house a group of Veterans while they visit for their fly fishing experience. The goal figure of for this campaign represents our first steps in building a physical structure on one of our favorite spots on the river.

If you are or know a Veteran who could use our help, please send them over to our site:  flyfishingwarriors.com/.

The Fly Fishing Lodge for Wounded Warriors was established by U.S. Military Veterans as a fly fishing haven for their fellow Veterans returning from the battlefield with traumatic injuries.

story:
Short Summary

Hi there.

My name is Arek Karagoezian and I am a 26 year old registered nurse working in the Cardiac Care Unit of AUB medical center. I am also a volunteer member of Stronghold's band and YFC (Youth For Christ).

In 2008 I took part in a bike ride that was 4300 miles and 60 days long crossing the United States from west coast to east coast. It was a very positive experience during which we raised awareness and funds for the work of YFC. Now I will be participating in a bike ride around Switzerland for the same cause. It will be one week long, covering a distance of 775 Km through the Swiss Alps. I believe reaching out to teenagers and helping them reach maturity on many levels is the best investment one can make, to be effective in making a positive change in this world. This is what we do at YFC with an emphasis on spiritual maturity in Christ, by introducing them to Christ and helping them become devoted followers.

By helping us financially you will contribute to 2 main elements of our summer camp. One will be sponsoring teens who can't pay the registration costs, so that they may attend and hear the Gospel. We believe that finances should not be a barrier to someone getting a chance to hear about Jesus. We are expecting around 100 kids at summer camp this year.

The second is that we are planning to buy tents to help accomodate a larger number of kids at camp this year. We want to allow for at least 25 students who will be staying in these tents. This investment would not be for just a one time thing. These tents will also be used for weekend camping and retreats as well as future summer camps. It is a long term investment.

We thank you for partnering with us and helping us financially. We would also like your support in prayer as we consider that the most important support anyone can give. 

If you know people around you who would like to hear about this cause and maybe keep us in prayer, and/or like to make a contribution, please don't hold back, let them know. 

Thank you and please stay in touch

In 2008 I took part in a bike ride that was 4300 miles and 60 days long crossing the United States from west coast to east coast. It was a very positive experience during which we raised awareness and funds for the work of YFC. Now I will be participating in a bike ride around Switzerland for the same cause. It will be one week long, covering a distance of 775 Km through the Swiss Alps. I believe reaching out to teenagers and helping them reach maturity on many levels is the best investment one can make, to be effective in making a positive change in this world. This is what we do at YFC with an emphasis on spiritual maturity in Christ, by introducing them to Christ and helping them become devoted followers.
By helping us financially you will contribute to 2 main elements of our summer camp. One will be sponsoring teens who can't pay the registration costs, so that they may attend and hear the Gospel. We believe that finances should not be a barrier to someone getting a chance to hear about Jesus. We are expecting around 100 kids at summer camp this year.
The second is that we are planning to buy tents to help accomodate a larger number of kids at camp this year. We want to allow for at least 25 students who will be staying in these tents. This investment would not be for just a one time thing. These tents will also be used for weekend camping and retreats as well as future summer camps. It is a long term investment.


We thank you for partnering with us and helping us financially. We would also like your support in prayer as we consider that the most important support anyone can give. 
If you know people around you who would like to hear about this cause and maybe keep us in prayer, and/or like to make a contribution, please don't hold back, let them know. 
Thank you and please stay in touch

story:
================ ENGLISH ==================

(GREEK text follows further down - ακολουθεί πιο κάτω το κείμενο και στα ΕΛΛΗΝΙΚΑ)

About me and the story

During the last year the people of Athens went through a number of changes in their lives. Most of these changes are depicted on the faces of the inhabitants, while the outcome of those is reflected on the surrounding buildings.

My name is Christonikos Zonafos. I live in Athens / Greece and I see the city changing, showing both anger and peace, desperation and happiness. What I see everyday is what I'd like to show to you, holding a photography exibition and printing a hardcover book with the moments I've captured during the last year.

The exhibition will be held for two weeks - aiming for September 2012 - in the exhibition room of The Greek Comics Club in Athens, while the book will be available worldwide (through the internet) during the same dates.

 

What Is Needed & What You Get

What is needed is :

  • 750 euro (~1000$) for printing and framing the photographs (30 of them) for the exhibition
  • 200 euro (~250$) for printing an exhibition catalog along with some promotional material
  • 1400 euro (~1900$) for printing 50 hardcover photo-books and having them shipped
  • 700 euro (~950$) for printing 10 special oversized linen-hardcover photo-books and having them shipped (I like the look of it here: http://www.blurb.com/proline)

adding paypal & indiegogo payment fees and a small donation for the exhibition room it adds up to a total of 3500 euro (~4600$)

Here enters you! 
 
With your help this project can become reality :)
 
What you get in return for your help:
 
-----------------------------------------------------
Thank you!
5$ ~ 3,8euro
Thank you for supporting me!
Your name will be praised on my facebook page, my photoblog, my website and in the exhibition catalog as an IndieGoGo Supporter. :)
 
Digital Fan
25$ ~ 19euro
Let's get digital!
Your name will be praised on my facebook page, my photoblog, my website and in the exhibition catalog as an IndieGoGo Supporter.

PLUS you get:
A digital copy of book.
A set of 15 postcards with 5 different  photographs from my photoblog , signed with a thank you note. (postage included)
 
Exhibition Sponsor
60$ ~ 45euro
You just added one photograph to the exhibition!
Not only will your name be praised as above, but it will also be on the label by your chosen photograph at the exhibition.

You get all the above PLUS:

A signed 8x10" print of a photograph from the series - your choice! (postage included)
 
Book & Exhibition Sponsor
100$ ~ 75euro
Not only you added one photograph to the exhibition, but you also helped a book come to life!

You get all of the above PLUS:

You name will be in the book, thanking you as an IndieGoGo Supporter. :)

A signed harcover copy of the book. (postage included)
 
Special Sponsor
200$ ~ 150euro
Wow, you really know what you like!

You get all of the above PLUS:

You name will be in the book, thanking you as a Special IndieGoGo Supporter! :)

You also get ONE signed, numbered, special oversized linen-hardcover copy of the book - only up to 10 will be printed (postage included)
 
Hi 5! Exhibition Sponsor
250$ ~ 190euro
You really give life to this exhibition!

You have my eternal gratitude. In return you'll get everything detailed in the "Digital Fan" perk PLUS:
FIVE signed 8x10" prints of photographs from the series - your choice! (postage included)
Moreover, your name will be on the labels by your chosen photographs at the exhibition.
 
-----------------------------------------------------
 
 
Keep in mind that everything is made in limited edition, putting my wholeheartedly effort behind it.
Just remember, you can give whatever amount you see fit and if you think you can give in some other way just contact me.

 

This is a flexible project, meaning that I'll move on even if the goal is not reached. In that case, the exhibition will be my priority. If not even that is possible then I'll just print and send out the perks funded. Moreover, everyone funding as a Book or Special Sponsor will get a copy of the book, even if I have to print just a couple of them!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help funding you can still help by spreading the word.

Like, tweet, g+, or share in any way you want - more others may come to like the idea of this project :)

 

Anything more?

Check out my photoblog, facebook, web, twitter @zoofo, spread the word and don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Thank you!
 
 
 

================ ΕΛΛΗΝΙΚΑ ==================

Για Εμένα και Το Εγχείρημα

Τον τελευταίο χρόνο οι κάτοικοι της Αθήνας έχουν υποστεί πολλές αλλαγές στη ζωή τους. Οι περισσότερες από αυτές σκιαγραφούνται στα πρόσωπά τους, ενώ οι συνέπειές τους αντικατοπτρίζονται στα γύρω κτήρια.

Ονομάζομαι Χριστόνικος Ζονάφος. Ζω στην Αθήνα και βλέπω την πόλη να αλλάζει, βγάζοντας μαζί θυμό και ηραμία, απόγνωση και ευτυχία. Αυτό που βλέπω κάθε μέρα είναι αυτό που θέλω να σας δείξω κάνοντας μία έκθεση φωτογραφίας και τυπώνοντας ένα σκληρόδετο βιβλίο με στιγμές που απαθανάτισα τον τελευταίο χρόνο.
 
Η έκθεση θα είναι για δύο εβδομάδες - στοχεύοντας για τον Σεπτέμβριο του 2012 - στον εκθεσιακό χώρο της Λέσχης Φίλων Κόμικς στην Αθήνα, ενώ το βιβλίο θα είναι παντού (μέσω internet) τις ίδιες μέρες

 

Τι Χρειάζεται & Τι Παίρνετε

Αυτό που χρειάζεται είναι:

  • 750 euro (~1000$) για εκτύπωση και καδράρισμα των φωτογραφιών (30) για την έκθεση.
  • 200 euro (~250$) για την εκτύπωση ενός καταλόγου για την έκθεση, καθώς και υλικών προώθησης
  • 1400 euro (~1900$) για την εκτύπωση και αποστολή 50 σκληρόδετων φωτογραφικών βιβλίων
  • 700 euro (~950$) για την εκτύπωση και αποστολή 10 μεγάλων υφασματόδετων φωτογραφικών βιβλίων (Μου αρέσει όπως δείχνουν εδώ: http://www.blurb.com/proline)

μαζί με τέλη paypal & indiegogo που απαιτούνται και με μια μικρή δωρεά για τον εκθεσιακό χώρο φτάνουν στα 3400 euro (~4500$)

Εδώ μπαίνετε εσείς! 
 
Με τη βοήθειά σας αυτό το εγχείρημα μπορεί να γίνει πραγματικότητα :)
 
Αυτό που παίρνεται εσείς σε αντάλλαγμα για τη βοήθειά σας είναι:
 
-----------------------------------------------------
Thank you! (Ευχαριστώ!)
5$ ~ 3,8euro
Ευχαριστώ για την υποστήριξή σας!
Tο όνομά σας θα εγκωμιαστεί στη facebook σελίδα μου, στο photoblog μου, στο website μου και στον κατάλογο της έκθεσης ως IndieGoGo Υποστηρικτή. :)
 
 
Ψηφιακός Οπαδός (Digital Fan)
25$ ~ 19euro
Ψηφιακά!
Tο όνομά σας θα εγκωμιαστεί στη facebook σελίδα μου, στο photoblog μου, στο website μου και στον κατάλογο της έκθεσης ως IndieGoGo Υποστηρικτή.

ΕΠΙΠΛΕΟΝ από το προηγούμενο πακέτο παίρνετε:
Ένα ψηφιακό αντίγραφο του βιβλίου.
Ένα σετ 15 καρτποστάλ με 5 διαφορετικές φωτογραφίες από το photoblog μου, υπογεγραμμένες με ευχαριστίες. (συμπεριλαμβάνονται τα ταχυδρομικά)
 
 
Χορηγός Έκθεσης (ExhibitionSponsor)
60$ ~ 45euro
Μόλις προσθέσατε μία φωτογραφία στην έκθεση!
Όχι μόνο θα έχετε τις ευχαριστίες μου όπως στις προηγούμενες κατηγορίες, αλλά το όνομά σας θα μπει και στην ταμπελίτσα στην έκθεση για τη φωτογραφία που θα επιλέξετε.

Παίρνετε όλα τα παραπάνω από το προηγούμενο πακέτο και ΕΠΙΠΛΕΟΝ:

Ένα υπογεγραμμένο έργο της επιλογής σας από τη σειρά. Διαστάσεις 8x10" (~19x24cm). (συμπεριλαμβάνονται τα ταχυδρομικά)
 
Χορηγός Έκθεσης & Βιβλίου (Book & Exhibition Sponsor)
100$ ~ 75euro
Όχι μόνο προσθέσατε μία εικόνα στην έκθεση αλλά βοηθήσατε και να πάρει ζωή ένα βιβλίο!

Παίρνετε όλα τα παραπάνω από το προηγούμενο πακέτο και ΕΠΙΠΛΕΟΝ:

Το όνομά σας θα μπει στο βιβλίο, με ευχαριστίες ως IndieGoGo Υποστηρικτή. :)
 
Ένα υπογεγραμμένο σκληρόδετο αντίτυπο του βιβλίου. (συμπεριλαμβάνονται τα ταχυδρομικά)
 
Ειδικός Χορηγός (Special Sponsor)
200$ ~ 150euro
Ουάου! Πραγματικά ξέρετε τι σας αρέσει!

Παίρνετε όλα τα παραπάνω από το προηγούμενο πακέτο και ΕΠΙΠΛΕΟΝ:

Το όνομά σας θα μπει στο βιβλίο, με ευχαριστίες ως Ειδικού IndieGoGo Υποστηρικτή. :)
 
Επίσης παίρνετε ΕΝΑ υπογεγραμμένο, αριθμημένο, ξεχωριστό υφασματόδετο αντίτυπο του βιβλίου - μόνο μέχρι 10 θα τυπωθούν. (συμπεριλαμβάνονται τα ταχυδρομικά)
 
Κόλα 5! Χορηγέ Έκθεσης  (Hi 5! exhibition Sponsor)
250$ ~ 190euro
Πραγματικά δίνετε ζωή σ'αυτή την έκθεση!

έχετε την αιώνια ευγνωμοσύνη μου. Σε αντάλαγμα θα πάρετε ότι και ο "Ψηφιακός Οπαδός (Digital Fan)" και ΕΠΙΠΛΕΟΝ:
 
ΠΕΝΤΕ υπογεγραμμένα έργα της επιλογής σας από τη σειρά. Διαστάσεις 8x10" (~19x24cm). (συμπεριλαμβάνονται τα ταχυδρομικά)
 
Επίσης, το όνομά σας θα μπει και στις ταμπελίτσες στην έκθεση για τις φωτογραφίες που θα επιλέξετε.
 
-----------------------------------------------------
 
Θα ήθελα να επισημάνω πως όλα θα είναι σε περιορισμένες εκδόσεις, υποστηρίζοντάς τα με την πλήρη προσπάθειά μου.
Μπορείτε να δώσετε οποιοδήποτε ποσό πιστεύεται ότι αρμόζει και αν μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε με κάποιον άλλο τρόπο απλά επικοινωνήστε μαζί μου.

Αυτό είναι ένα "flexible project", που σημαίνει ότι θα συνεχίσω με το εγχείρημα ακόμα και αν δεν επιτευχθεί ο συνολικός στόχος. σε αυτή την περίπτωση η έκθεση θα είναι η πρώτη προτεραιότητα. Αν ούτε αυτό είναι δυνατό να γίνει τότε θα τυπωθούν και θα στείλω απλά ότι θα έχει ζητηθεί μέχρι εκείνη τη στιγμή. Επίσης, όποιος βοηθήσει ως "Χορηγός Βιβλίου" ή "Ειδικός Χορηγός" θα πάρει κανονικά ένα αντίτυπο του βιβλίου ακόμα και εάν αναγκαστώ να τυπώσω μόνο 2!

Άλλοι Τρόποι Που Μπορείτε Να Βοηθήσετε

Ακόμα και αν δεν μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε με χρήματα μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε διαδίδοντας το εγχείρημα.

Κάντε Like, tweet, g+, ή μοιραστείτε το με όποιον τρόπο θέλετε - η ιδέα του εγχειρήματος μπορεί να αρέσει και σε άλλους :)

 

Τίποτα άλλο?

Δείτε το photoblog μου, facebook, web, twitter @zoofo, διαδώστε το και μην διστάσετε να επικοινωνήσετε μαζί μου αν έχετε κάποια ερώτηση.

Ευχαριστώ!

-----------------------------------------------------
 
Θα ήθελα να επισημάνω πως όλα θα είναι σε περιορισμένες εκδόσεις, υποστηρίζοντάς τα με την πλήρη προσπάθειά μου.
Μπορείτε να δώσετε οποιοδήποτε ποσό πιστεύεται ότι αρμόζει και αν μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε με κάποιον άλλο τρόπο απλά επικοινωνήστε μαζί μου.

Αυτό είναι ένα "flexible project", που σημαίνει ότι θα συνεχίσω με το εγχείρημα ακόμα και αν δεν επιτευχθεί ο συνολικός στόχος. σε αυτή την περίπτωση η έκθεση θα είναι η πρώτη προτεραιότητα. Αν ούτε αυτό είναι δυνατό να γίνει τότε θα τυπωθούν και θα στείλω απλά ότι θα έχει ζητηθεί μέχρι εκείνη τη στιγμή. Επίσης, όποιος βοηθήσει ως "Χορηγός Βιβλίου" ή "Ειδικός Χορηγός" θα πάρει κανονικά ένα αντίτυπο του βιβλίου ακόμα και εάν αναγκαστώ να τυπώσω μόνο 2!


Άλλοι Τρόποι Που Μπορείτε Να Βοηθήσετε
Ακόμα και αν δεν μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε με χρήματα μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε διαδίδοντας το εγχείρημα.
Κάντε Like, tweet, g+, ή μοιραστείτε το με όποιον τρόπο θέλετε - η ιδέα του εγχειρήματος μπορεί να αρέσει και σε άλλους :)
 
Τίποτα άλλο?
Δείτε το photoblog μου, facebook, web, twitter @zoofo, διαδώστε το και μην διστάσετε να επικοινωνήσετε μαζί μου αν έχετε κάποια ερώτηση.
Ευχαριστώ!

story:
Short Summary

Brown Skateboard is creative, simple, wild products that will be invented with amazing ideas in custom package design, snap back hats, skateboards decks. The t-shirt's will have original logo in different colors, illustration, idea concept behind Brown Skateboard. The goal is to gather little kids, young teens, older adults, to do a film of themselves in what they accomplish in their goals. We are also focus on skateboarders, and other athletics that is taking their success to a higher level.

  • Gildan 12000-Small-XL-Women
  • Fabric-Cotton/Poly Blend

  • Gildan 5000L- Small- XL-Women

on this even though I didn't post it. Click on link below to see the website. 
  • Link: DieCutStickers.com


About Me:

I am a starter in my business Brown Skateboard, and I freelance part-time as a graphic designer by doing flyers, business cards and much more. Also, I deliver newspaper as part-time too. I will be thrill to get my project in reality.  All these products I need is to sale to customers in person at trade shows and get a property lot in my area that I can only use for 6 months. I came up with my business because I struggle doing college as a graphic designer, and I strive for my goals as I graduated in March 2012. I'm doing this because I believe some of us wants to follow our goals, dreams, passion in what we do in our lives.

You can learn more about me here: LinkedIn

You can view my graphic design work here: Behance


Store Website:

 Brown Skateboard

 

Why I need this:

I want to express who I am as a graphic designer to follow my passion in designing t-shirt's to be screen print, tag-less print, and stickers. I never thought I will be doing this in my future of this year. I am amazed how far I got in my journey in education, college, working hard to succeed.

What the money is going to:

The screen print production I need some help for it to get started. Majority of the money is going to the production of the t-shirt's, sweaters, and digital die cut stickers print. 

Links:

Follow me on twitter and like me on facebook to view photos and updates!


Risks & Challenges

Learn accountability of Truth

 Being a business woman can be tough at times, by getting everything in order to make phone calls to ask questions in products, and marketing myself. I want to explore my products to customers for they can enjoy and wait to see my creative side. My inspiration idols are Johnny Cupcakes, Ugmonk, Huf, Zooyork and much more. I am grateful for the support that will be shared through Indiegogo. Word of mouth, and using social media to share to your friends, family is helpful to me.

Thank you for your time!

story:
L'aventure en quelques mots

A bord d’un 4×4, l’objectif est de rallier l’étape du jour à l’aide d’un roadbook et d’une boussole, en parcourant le minimum de kilomètres, tout en respectant les différents contrôles de passage. La notion de vitesse n’est pas retenue, seul le kilométrage et le franchissement sont à la base du classement.

Le Trophée Roses des Andes comporte plusieurs étapes d’orientation et de franchissement, ainsi qu’une étape marathon, à savoir 2 jours dont une nuit en autonomie. Et parce qu’on ne parcourt pas ces régions avec des œillères, le Trophée Roses des Andes, c’est aussi une action solidaire forte et une conscience évidente de son impact sur l’environnement.

 

A propos des Cœurs Cœurs Paillettes

Océane, 27 ans | Pilote tout terrain | Sa devise "il en faut peu pour être heureux"
Julie, 26 ans | Copilote, GPS intégré | Sa devise " Hakuna Matata"

Nous sommes l'équipage N°65 !

 

Nous nous sommes rencontrées lors de nos études à Lyon, et au départ nous n’avons pas été amies... Cependant c’est venu rapidement ! Ensemble nous avons déjà fait pas mal de choses : une mission humanitaire de quatre mois au Pérou - qui nous a rendue inséparables, 19.000 KM autour de l'Australie en trois mois et un tour de l'Indonésie en deux mois. C’est donc aussi le goût du voyage, de l’aventure et du partage qui nous soudent.

 

 Les différents coûts du projet

Le projet nous reviendra en tout à 18500€. Il nous reste actuellement à trouver 16700€ afin de pouvoir participer à l'aventure ! Nous nous sommes inscrites, nous avons déjà le matériel d'orientation et géolocalisation mais, vous l'aurez compris, nous avons besoin de votre soutien afin de monter dans l'avion et porter ce projet en Argentine ! Pour cela, nous vous proposons plusieurs contreparties qui vous permettront d'obtenir des lots en échange de votre participation, ou nous aider à avancer de quelques kilomètres.

 

Soutenez / suivez-nous !

story:
Now available at thescrubba.com.au for Australian orders and thescrubba.com for US and global orders.

An evolution of the original Scrubba wash bag, the lightweight stealth pack offers greater functionality for travellers, outdoor adventurers, and eco-commuters by combining the signature internal washboard with several new features to enable innovative stealth functions for: 

  • washing clothes anywhere
  • keeping gear dry
  • showering anywhere
  • packing smaller

Outdoor enthusiasts can now do more with less by using just one lightweight bag to protect their gear from the elements, compress down bulky items like jackets and sleeping bags, and even wash their clothing and themselves, absolutely anywhere. 

Keeping gear protected from rain and dry at the beach, the stealth pack is the ideal backpack for travellers. At night, it can be used to wash clothing in just minutes, saving money while reducing luggage size. The Scrubba stealth pack can also be used as a convenient carry-on bag, or can be packed down small thanks to the compression function.

A durable, weatherproof backpack spacious enough to accommodate daily essentials and most laptop sizes, the stealth pack is ideal for commuters who are routinely exposed to the elements.  

1 pack | 4 stealth functions | No limits

 

Key features of the Scrubba stealth pack

 

Weatherproof function - keep gear dry

The 40 denier, TPU coated nylon fabric works in conjunction with the weatherproof seal to protect your gear from whatever the elements - or your adventures - might throw at it.

 

Washing machine function - wash clothes anywhere

Equipped with our signature flexible, internal washboard, the stealth pack is able to provide a machine-quality wash anywhere in just minutes. Simply add water and cleaning liquid, roll down the top and seal the bag, remove air through the twist-valve, and rub for 30 seconds to 3 minutes. After a quick rinse in the bag, clothing is ready to dry.

 

Compression bag function - pack smaller

Minimise your luggage and maximise your travels! The Scrubba stealth pack's XL twist-style valve works with the shoulder straps to compress gear. Simply fill with clothing, roll and clip, expel air via the valve, wrap and clip the shoulder straps, and pack and go.

 

Camp shower function - shower anywhere

Perfect for overnight treks, camping out in the wilderness, or quickly rinsing off after a trip to the beach. Simply add 4-6 litres of water (1-1.5 gal), use one of the shoulder straps to clip the pack upside down, and twist the valve to control the water flow.

 

Other features - Load it up and go

Boasting multiple gear loops for the easy attachment of small items, a carry handle for maximum portability, and adjustable shoulder and sternum straps for heightened comfort, the stealth pack has got your back through every adventure.  

 

 

Scrubba stealth pack specs

Travel clean, light and free with the Scrubba stealth pack

 

Now shipping

Thanks to the great (and early) support of our backers, we were able to fast-track manufacturing and as of 18 August 2017, we have started shipping orders (yep 2 months ahead of schedule).  All Australian orders have been shipped and US orders will be sent on or just after 24 August 2017.  International orders will be shipped from 28 August 2017.  As we have extended our campaign, new orders will shipped as quickly as possible once placed.

The following image shows the final packaged Scrubba stealth pack:

 

And these are some of our Australian orders packed and ready to go with more stock behind in master cartons:

Finally, the following video shows the key features and functions of the Scrubba stealth pack that we are shipping to backers:

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have received many suggestions from the travelling community regarding a  neutral-coloured, larger wash bag capable of washing higher volumes at once, and are therefore confident that the Scrubba stealth pack's increased capacity and 'stealth' black colour fill a much-needed gap in the outdoor market. The Scrubba stealth pack is the outcome of our desire to add a little extra to the ordinary by creating a product that does it all, and we have innovated in accordance with our supporters' needs to ensure that our products evolve and continue to provide the best, most practical solutions for travellers everywhere. 

We are hoping to raise $5000 from the campaign, giving us the confidence to proceed with the first production run.  We already have the materials ready, we just need the green light from you. 

Risks & Challenges

This is our fifth crowdfunding campaign in the span of five years. Despite hurdles along the way, we have completed and fulfilled our previous four campaigns within only a few months, and from these experiences have learned how best to increase our overall efficiency. We therefore have great confidence that we will be able to ship most (if not all) Scrubba stealth pack orders within a month of the campaign's close. 

Although we do not anticipate any significant set backs or complications, we do believe in honesty and great customer service, so in the unlikely event that a delay does pop up, we will let you know and will quickly provide our strategy for getting back on track. So feel free to jump on-board and see how you can pack smaller and go further with the Scrubba stealth pack. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if the Scrubba stealth pack isn't for you, we still value your input and appreciate your support. That's why we'd love you to: 

  • Let your friends and family know about the stealth pack
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word online

Media

If you would like to write a feature or create other media about the Scrubba stealth pack, we invite you to access our media kit and high-res images at: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/juunpjpehdb3u1t/AADKz7--TxEuuXcrB-ElC5b4a?dl=0

Thanks in advance for spreading the word about our campaign, and please feel free to contact us at info@thescrubba.com if you require further information. 

Our Previous Crowdfunding Success

In 2012 we revolutionised travel laundry by integrating a flexible washboard into a waterproof bag. By bringing the concept of the washboard into the 21st century, we created a new technology that has since been enjoyed by over 100,000 travellers around the globe. The support we received from the crowdfunding community was overwhelming, and we have been committed to developing lightweight, durable, portable, multi-functional, and environmentally-conscious products ever since: 

The Scrubba wash bag (2012): Crowdfunded on Indiegogo following founder and patent attorney Ash Newland's mission to overcome the difficulty of effectively washing clothes while hiking Mt Kilimanjaro, the Scrubba wash bag ultimately raised 22,525USD of its 2,500USD goal, and has today become a pack favourite across the globe. 

The Scrubba W Pack (2015):  A backpack, wash bag and dry bag rolled into one, the W pack ultimately received 27,861USD, smashing its Indiegogo goal by 123%. 

The Scrubba weightless wallet (2016): Crowdfunded late last year with a final pledge result of 18,385AUD, this 7g (~0.25oz) water- and sweat-resistant travel and active wallet is 100% upcycled using excess material from the Scrubba wash bag. Finishing its Kickstarter run in early October 2016, all pledges had been fulfilled and shipped by early December.

The Allurette washer (2017): Having completed its Indiegogo run in March of this year, we were thrilled to have all original pledges shipped by mid-April. The Allurette washer continued to receive great support on our InDemand campaign until its conclusion in May, and ultimately received 16,485USD of its 5000USD goal. 

Thanks so much for your support and enthusiasm.

FAQ

How does the Scrubba stealth pack differ from the Scrubba W pack? 

In addition to switching out our vivid Scrubba green fabric for a neutral black that allows for increased discreetness, the Scrubba stealth pack is 40% larger, enabling it to easily carry more gear and to more effectively wash bulkier items. The Scrubba stealth pack also carries an array of updates that improve upon our original design, and is thus a more technical backpack that has been built specially for the outdoors. The old squeeze valve located on our W pack has been replaced with an XL twist-style mechanism to allow for easier compression and greater versatility, while the shoulder straps have been upgraded for maximum comfort and durability. The stealth pack also features a square base for increased accessibility, along with gear loops for the convenient attachment of small outdoor accessories and a side handle for maximum portability. 

Just how multi-functional is the Scrubba stealth pack? 

We are passionate about creating multi-functional items that can be helpfully adapted in a multitude of ways to increase productivity in both urban jungles and rural environments. Although the primary uses of the Scrubba stealth pack are as a high-quality backpack, wash bag, compression dry bag, and camp shower, we have received much feedback over the years in relation to a diverse range of impressive uses for our products, bound to suit all travellers' needs. These include filling the pack with clothing, either to use as a makeshift pillow or to provide a soft environment that is ideal for transporting delicate items and souvenirs, and filling with ice for use as a makeshift ice pack/bag. Removing the stealth pack's detachable shoulder straps can afford even greater versatility, enabling the pack to be compactly stored in a larger case for use as a packing cell or laundry bag that separates dirty clothes from clean ones. 

How does the Scrubba stealth pack wash clothes?

The Scrubba stealth pack works on the same principle as an old-fashion washboard, and functions in an identical manner to our earlier Scrubba wash bag and W pack products. To wash a load of clothing, you need simply add clothes, water, and your preferred detergent to the appropriate marking level indicated on the bag's exterior, roll down the top seal and clip the ends together, twist open the valve to remove excess air, seal the valve, and then rub clothes against the internal washboard for 30 seconds - 3 minutes. You can monitor the washing process via the pack's clear viewing window. When clothes are clean, you need simply unseal the bag, replace the dirty water with fresh water, reseal without deflating, give the bag a firm shake to rinse off residual detergent, and then remove and hang the clothes to dry. 

How can I use the stealth pack as a camp shower? 

When hung from a tree and clipped upside down using one of the shoulder straps, the Scrubba stealth pack's XL valve is capable of releasing a slow, steady stream of water. This transforms it into makeshift, outdoor shower that is perfect for overnight treks, camping out in the wilderness, or quickly rinsing off after a trip to the beach. Simply fill the bag with 4-6 litres (1-1.5 gal) of water, roll and clip the opening, and twist open the valve to wash off the sweat of a long day. You can even use the valve to adjust the water flow as you shower.  

How can I use the stealth pack as a compression bag? 

Although the stealth pack makes for an ideal piece of carry-on baggage, we understand that everyone travels differently and that some travellers may prefer a different type of carry-on/day bag. To ensure that the stealth pack remains beneficial for these people, we have included a compression feature that enables you to downsize your luggage in order to avoid a bulky, disorganised suitcase. The Scrubba stealth pack's XL twist-style valve enables the bag to compress down for maximum storage and portability, allowing you to always implement the most efficient packing strategy. Simply load the stealth pack with gear, roll and clip the top, release the air via the valve, and tighten the straps around the bag to cinch everything in place and ensure it remains as compressed as possible throughout your journey. Then insert your compressed bag into a larger suitcase or backpack to benefit from smaller, lighter luggage. This method is also great for keeping gear neat and organised throughout your travels, preventing you from losing sight of that one, pesky sock!

Should I use the stealth pack as a compression bag or as carry-on luggage?

The choice is yours! If you already have a favourite carry-on bag or struggle to find efficient methods for packing your suitcase, the compression feature could suit you. However, if you plan on using the Scrubba stealth pack as your day bag throughout your trip, and only require a basic backpack for your flight, using the stealth pack as a carry-on is likely your best option. As the stealth pack fits most laptop sizes and offers 21L of capacity, it is a handy piece of gear to take along on your flight, but the best feature is its adaptability, so you can variously use it as a carry-on bag, day bag, compression bag, or even as a packing cell or laundry bag, depending on what suits your needs at any given time. 

What are the dimensions of the Scrubba stealth pack?

The stealth pack has a maximum capacity of 21L and measures 54cm x 32cm (21 x 13') when laid flat.  However, as the washing method requires you to seal the bag and rub the clothes against the washboard from the outside, the optimal working volume for the washing process is around 2-8L (0.5-2 GAL).  The markings on the front of the pack make it easy to always add the right volumes. 

Is the stealth pack waterproof?

The Scrubba stealth pack is made from the same durable, waterproof material as our Scrubba wash bag and W packs, using the same manufacturing method. In this regard, the pack provides great protection from rain, snow, and the like. However, we would not recommend submerging the pack entirely, as water can escape through the seal from time to time. In this regard, the stealth pack is weatherproof and water-resistant, but is not totally waterproof and should therefore not be fully submerged if it is loaded with contents that cannot be exposed to water. 

What is the stealth pack made from? 

The stealth pack is made from a durable 40 denier nylon fabric with a polyurethane coating to ensure maximum style, comfort, and durability. 

How long does a load take to wash in the Scrubba stealth pack?

For a machine quality wash, we recommend using a few drops of washing detergent and then rubbing the clothes against the washboard for 2-3 minutes. For stubborn stains, the clothing may be rubbed for longer and/or allowed to soak in the stealth pack prior to rubbing. If soaking clothing in the stealth pack, ensure it is stored upright (e.g. seal facing upwards) to prevent water wicking through the seal.

Are the straps adjustable and removable?

Yes. The straps can be fully adjusted according to your own preference, and can be removed as needed, giving you the flexibility to travel in a way that suits you. 

How much luggage will fit in the stealth pack?

The stealth pack is a 21L backpack that is capable of holding most of the gear you would typically need for flights or basic day trips. It can accommodate most laptop sizes and has plenty of room left over for necessities including passports and wallets. The gear loops afford additional storage space, enabling small items like raincoats or drink bottles to be attached to the outside of the pack, freeing up space within. 

How much clothing can be washed in the Scrubba stealth pack at once? 

The Scrubba stealth pack can accommodate plenty of gear when used as a backpack, but washing efficiency may be compromised if too much clothing is added during the washing process, so we recommend limiting the amount of items you wash together. With 40% larger capacity than the Scrubba wash bag, the stealth pack can typically wash about 3 t-shirts, a couple of pairs of socks, and a couple of pairs of underwear at once. Bulkier items, like jeans and jumpers/sweaters, should be washed separately for the best results. The recommended working volume is 2-8L (0.5-2 GAL), and the fill level markings on the bag's exterior will help you to determine the appropriate water levels in relation to different sized loads. 

Can I use hot water in the Scrubba stealth pack?

Due to the waterproof lining of the bag, we recommend that water no hotter than 50°C (122°F) be used. Simply put, if it is too hot to hold your hands in, the water is too hot for the Scrubba stealth pack.

How can I dry the Scrubba stealth pack after use? 
To expedite the drying process and achieve the best level of hygiene, we recommend removing the straps and turning the Scrubba stealth pack inside out after use.  When inverted, you can make good use of the clips to hang the bag to dry.

What cleaning liquid should I use in the Scrubba stealth pack?

We've found the use of liquid detergents to be more efficient, as they, unlike solid detergents (powders, leaves etc.), do not require additional time to dissolve. Using a liquid also enables active suds immediately, reducing the overall washing time. For ultra-lightweight travellers, a small dollop of 3-in-1 bodywash-shampoo-shave liquid may be used, as we have found that this typically works well in refreshing clothes.You can test for quantities of different cleaning products in the stealth pack by checking the amount of suds visible through the clear section of the bag. If you still have suds after 30 seconds of rubbing, you can probably reduce the amount of detergent for the next load. Optimising the amount is not only better for the environment, but will also minimise the amount of rinsing required. Avoid the use of detergents containing harsh chemicals, bleach, or ammonia, as these ingredients will reduce the Scrubba stealth pack's longevity.

How long will the Scrubba stealth pack last and how do I care for it?

The Scrubba stealth pack has been built to last, but you can take some small steps to ensure maximum longevity. These include avoiding contact with sharp objects that could puncture the fabric during the washing process, and avoiding washing with strong bleaches, on abrasive surfaces, and at high temperatures.

How do I dry my clothes after using the Scrubba stealth pack?

After rinsing the clothing, gently squeeze the excess water from your garments. You can then either hang the clothes to dry as normal or, to expedite the drying process, lay the wet garments on a clean, dry towel, before rolling up the towel to encase the clothes. Press down on the rolled-up towel to encourage water absorption, then hang the damp clothes to dry.
