story:
**UPDATE 3-03-14**

Almost two weeks since our campaign debuted and we’ve met our goal of $2,000 on Indiegogo.
We are all so thankful and filled with excitement that our dreams of playing in World Cup VII in Myrtle Beach have been made possible because of all of our supporters.

Because we have 10 days left to raise money, we are setting a SECOND GOAL of $3,000.

There are still a few expenses the team has to pay for out of pocket— International Quidditch Association fees and food/miscellaneous expendables in Myrtle Beach.

Each and every one of you are making QCB's road to Myrtle Beach possible. Thank you so much.


Who Are We?

We’re Q.C. Boston: The Massacre, the Northeast's premier community team.

This team has members from California, New York, Florida, and, more locally, Emerson College and Boston University. Together, we've formed a family as a group of individuals looking to win this year's World Cup. 

The idea for the team was created two summers ago while Kedzie Teller and Zach D’Amico were abroad playing for Team USA. Once Zach graduated from Villanova and moved to Boston, they decided it was time to put the plan in motion. So far, QCB has found some great success in our first semester of existence. We’ve given great matches to top-tier teams including Emerson and BU, and at Northeast Regionals we won our pool on Day 1 and qualified for the World Cup on Day 2.

This year, though, we're all in a situation we've never faced before--getting to the world cup as a community team. We don't belong to a school, so we don't get funding--and unfortunately we don't have machines portkeys that warp us right to South Carolina!

Our Purpose

We have this Indiegogo going here in order to help us fund some of our expensive trip. There are many costs that quickly add up for a community team. We're trying to raise $2000 dollars so we can pay for flights, transportation, and housing for 19 players to South Carolina.

If we don't reach our goal, then there's a very fair chance we won't be able to attend the first cup in our team's existence.

NO GOAL, NO MONEY, NO WORLD CUP

We're a team full of unique people from all corners of the country. Coming together so quickly hasn't been easy, but these guys have made it all worth it. This, however, is our biggest obstacle yet--any and all donations will be greatly appreciated.

OUR BUDGET

Your generous donations will get the 19-roster QC Boston team to World Cup VII in North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina on April 5-6, 2013.  The money we earn will go towards the following:

  • Flights
  • Hotels
  • Transportation

With your help, QC Boston, the Northeast's premier community team, will be able to compete at World Cup VII!

THE TEAM 

Kedzie Teller, Captain, Change Agent Consultant @ MassMutual, Chaser, #9

Ben Nadeau, Captain, Senior @ Emerson College, Chaser/Seeker, #5

Zach D'Amico, Captain, Graduate Student @ Harvard Law, Chaser #10

Jayke Archibald, Marketing and Telecommunications Consultant, Utility, #13

Victor Viega, Sophomore @ Emerson College, Keeper, #8

Sheldon Bostic, United States Army Veteran, Beater/Chaser, #4

Griffin Conlogue, Junior @ Emerson College, Utility, #3

Ryan Barnada, Award Winning Sound Engineer, Seeker, #23

Sarah Ballister, Faculty Assistant @ Harvard Business School, Beater, #17

Elise Risio, Freshman @ Emerson College, Chaser, #2

Bobby O'Neil, Recent Emerson College Graduate & Budding Writer/Publishing Agent, Beater, #15

Matt Lowe, Senior Designer @ CoachUp, Chaser, #111

Lisa Obermayer, Yellow-Fin Tuna Expert, Chaser, #18

Jimmy McInnis, Freshman @ Emerson College, Chaser/Keeper, #25

Rebecca Contreras, Junior @ Emerson College, Beater, #22

Dan Miller, Budding Graphic Designer, Keeper, #11

Vic Kelman, Senior @ Boston University, Chaser, #7

Kara Levis, Recent UCLA Graduate & Tutor, Beater, #21

Brian Zanghi, Freshman @ Boston University, Chaser, #1 


To watch us play, click on the links below!

QCB vs. University of Rochester http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wb-uMIZQzKw

QCB vs. Hofstra University http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=md9OlWMjaoM


Prize Information

Link to QCB's fashion catalogue: Click for the catalogue!

Photo of Cutters X40 gloves: http://i.imgur.com/OY6TG69.png

story:
Cliff Notes

Like many of you I have always loved camping and hiking the outdoors, that is partly what drew me to join the Army as a Special Forces recruit back in 2003. I spent a lot of time training in the outdoors with my most memorable trip being to the Yukon in 2008. We arrived at the perfect time and it was still warm enough to bivouac under the stars and northern lights. Oh how the sky danced that night!

As I have aged I have noticed that my ability to find comfort on any surface has been severely diminished. It is also very difficult to pack a family into a bivouac and keep sane! Many of you may be familiar with one of the most important items for military personal as well, communication. I had these elements in mind when I started my search for something better than the simple tent for our outdoor adventures. It was very important for me to meet the goals of sustainability, mobility, connectivity and leisure comfort.

The Recreational Vehicle (RV) has the ability to meet all of these goals as it provides the amenities of climate control, a solid roof over our head, and even a comfy bed. I was all set to find an RV our family likes and then a conflict started in my soul. There was no option that met my goal of sustainability without giving up other aspects of RVing I love like the comfort of indoor leisure space and a full service kitchen. On top of that conflict all the best tech gadgets for RVing had to be added as an aftermarket add-on that created confusion and more work to install. I consider myself pretty handy, having grown up working in the family home construction business, but I didn't want to spend a lot of money on an RV and then spend a lot of time getting it just the way I wanted.

Later that year I started playing hockey on our coed league team, the IceHawks, with some very talented guys that provided some skills I thought were ideal to meet my issues with current RVs head on. Josh is an alternative fuels technician and installs Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) on fleet vehicles and CJ is a mechanic and fabricator with a passion for excellence. Josh's skill in CNG would address the largest part of my sustainability quest by reducing the emissions on the motor that transports the RV to the campsite. CJ's skill in fabrication helped us to dial in our Class A motorhome plans and assists with the technical side of executing our design. 

Our unique and talented team will achieve success in bringing this dream to reality but you can help. Every donation no matter how small will give us fuel to prove to the accelerator we are participating in that we are worthy of further resources. It will also give us confidence that the time and personal resources we are dedicating to this concept is worth the sacrifices we make. If you find yourself wishing you did not have to add aftermarket gadgets to your RV to get it dialed in and wish your RV polluted less and required less maintenance ask yourself this: Can you see your family in a Gäshawk motorhome?

The Journey Matters

We have all heard the phrase but what does it mean. To me it means that we learn incredible amounts of things on our journey that it becomes part of who we are. I had a team member that worked with the fuel I thought would be perfect for a sustainable motorhome but did not know much else about this fuel. We quickly realized this same fuel could also supply fuel to our climate control systems and full service kitchen so we no longer needed to lug around and fuel up a propane tank. Josh educated us on the many benefits of using this clean burning fuel such as we would spend 25% less time and money maintaining the engine because it was so clean burning. CNG fills up at a pump much like gasoline and diesel and fills in roughly the same time so it does not have the issues electric vehicles have. CJ has family that has worked in the RV business for years and we were located 20 miles from the RV capital of the world so we were off and running.

We entered a local competition at the University of Notre Dame called the McCloskey Business Plan competition. This competition provided some great resources and mentors from one of the most prestigious business schools in the nation! The structure of the competition helped us do our first survey and come up with a compelling business plan to reach our goal of building our first prototype. The first thing we learned from this competition is that building a prototype RV is not cheap, we really didn't think it would be but the engineering, possible patent process and time needed to build it out was a daunting mountain laid out before us. We also learned that there were lots  of great ideas coming out of the University of Notre Dame and ours would not make the finals. This would not be my first mountain to climb as I was stationed in Alaska for quite some time and love to hike. We knew we just needed to put one foot in front of the other.

Our survey showed that people generally are open to CNG but are not aware of the availability of this fuel. The great thing is that a lot of people use natural gas in their homes and we can design an RV that fuels up at home. We can also use existing tech to update a navigation system to have all CNG stations plotted on a given route so this would help our target customers find their fuel. A few things were glaringly obvious from our survey; people wanted quality craftsmanship, better internet connectivity, standard tech built into their RV and to spend less time maintaining their RV. This last one should be obvious as we all want to spend more time enjoying the outdoors rather than tinkering on an engine!

We received lots of feedback from our McCloskey mentors that we needed to focus on the luxury RV market and find things to make CNG more "sexy". Not sure what many of you think as I don't find any fuel "sexy" but I had to admit that Tesla sure did make souped up electric cars sexy. A local business owner let me drive his Tesla Model S a few years back and I remembered that experience vividly. This car had handles that popped out when I walked up to it. It unlocked as I grasped the handles and hummed to life as I sat down. The car had a huge display screen with a beautiful backup camera but it also displayed all the systems on an intuitive dashboard. The car vibrated if I got close to the white line on the side of the road and assisted me with every aspect of driving that I could imagine. Oh yeah it also almost made my skin peel off when I stomped on the accelerator when my friend told me to.

This formidable experience with a true luxury car is what inspired our shift from merely a CNG RV to the smart way to RV that we now have in our concept RV. We want to make your experience with our RV last a lifetime and help you juggle your busy family and professional life. We are not reinventing the wheel here, we have just found a better way to turn it. Keep reading to learn more!

Visions of Taking Flight

So you have and overview on why we are undertaking this endeavor but how will it change the landscape of RVs out there on the market. I have been told that the best way to communicate this is to tell a story about our fictional fanatical customer, John. Any similarities to any person living or deceased is purely coincidental.

Our fictional friend is an avid outdoors athlete and travels with his RV to triathlon competitions as well as other sporting venues. John also has a busy day as a fund manager for a large national mutual fund company. John is preparing for his next competition and has a few days left before he hits the road, so he checks his app to see how ready the RV is to travel. The app lets him know that the fuel is topped off, water is good to go, and the black tank is empty. The app gives him a readout that estimates he could be ready to hit the road in 1 hour and 30 mins after arriving home based on his last monitored departure. The app does remind him that food stores have not been stocked yet and neither has his race bike, wet suit or his clothing as the closet and bike storage are empty.

That reminds John that he must pick up his bike from the shop as some new tires were being fitted. A few days later John is departing after having fully stocked his RV, the app quietly records the time it took him to stock and outfit the RV for travel, since John had stored the bike the day before and had a list of groceries to pick up on the way home he was able to hit the road in 45 mins! The navigation system plots all of Johns favorite stops for getting CNG fuel on the way to his destination and gives reminders to points of interest he may like.

Upon arriving at his destination John is relieved to have his docking checklist pop up on his integrated system monitor as he quickly sets up camp. The system reminds him that this campground installed natural gas utilities for his campsite earlier this year! When John is done with the docking checklist the integrated system monitor displays a summary of all the important systems on the dashboard. John decides to do a quick run the next morning to check out the course and get used to the atmosphere. When John leaves his RV the next morning the system has already learned how to lock the doors after he has left range of the Wi-Fi.

John’s run was invigorating, and he wore his fitness tracker to monitor his stats. As he arrives back at his RV the data is automatically uploaded to his computer inside, so he can look it over. He was 2 mins slower on this run than he wanted, and he has some great elevation data for the course. He will have to remember that for the race. A couple days later John prepares to leave, he had done better on this race than he had expected and can’t wait for the next one. He is very happy that his undocking checklist walks him through his procedures as he almost forgot that he had been refueling his CNG tank!

Before he finishes the undocking, he is pleased to see a Facetime call is coming in from his wife and daughter as they were not able to make it to this race. John casts the call up to his large flat screen so he can better see the reactions as he relays the past events. When John is done with his call he picks up where he left off on his undocking list and quickly sets about to getting on the road. After dumping his tank and setting off down the highway his system pops up with a warning that a belt is failing thanks to the strategically placed IoT sensors. The system recommends a service schedule or offers to order the belt to be delivered to the home address. John elects to have service done as he has quite a full week ahead of him at the office and he lives close to his trusted service technician.

Milestones and Swag

As we mentioned, building a revolutionary coach is not cheap! We have broken down the overall goal of building our prototype into achievable milestones. Our first goal of raising $25,000 will showcase our validation to allow for further funding, and start our engineering process for the prototype. Reaching $100,000 will allow us to fully refurbish the used RV we plan on buying later this year. Reaching a stretch goal of $300,000 would allow us to build our basic prototype with the assistance of a local manufacturer. These numbers do assume that the majority of our funds raised are through swag orders as we cannot place 100% of those funds toward our goal as we still have to fulfill the orders. Large cash donations and the perks we offer ourselves have a greater impact and would allow us to meet these goals with less donations.

However lets talk about the swag! I have been excitedly working on the swag items for several months now and have focused on companies that share similar values to our own. We want to reward all our supporters and also let them feel good for helping our world out. 4Ocean will pull one pound of trash out of the oceans for each bracelet sold, and they look really cool to boot! Woodchuck USA plants a tree for every item sold and includes a card in the item so you can look your tree up and learn about their efforts! We have partnered with Woodchuck USA on the bottle openers and coaster sets. TenTree is our t-shirt partner* and they have a goal to plant ten trees in an impoverished country for every item sold! 

A Cleaner Impact

Our mission is to inspire all generations to engage nature in a responsible manner by building exceptional recreation vehicles. By supporting our cause you will change the dialog in RVs to include a focus on a smart way to RV. You will drive a change in supply channel demand that supports materials such as recycled plastics, aluminium, and paper in addition to sustainable materials like bamboo and hemp. You will also have the added benefit of giving life to the idea of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) engines in motor coach transportation which will reduce carbon dioxide emissions in these vehicles by 90% over diesel and gasoline engines!

While there are many of you that value the importance of reducing carbon dioxide emissions there must also be rewards for your ownership. CNG is such a clean fuel that it rewards our customers by reducing maintenance by a projected 25% or $2,000 a year! This is achieved by leaving less harmful deposits in the engine. Just think of what those harmful deposits from the other engines are doing to our air quality. In many places like California you will also save around $100 per fill up at the pump. And we have only talked about the platform that this smart RV is built on! By including the internet of things into your vehicle you will be able to drastically conserve resources, save time, and stay connected with those you love.

Headwinds

Every disruptive technology comes with its own specific challenges. Electric vehicle adoption you may recognize has been difficult due to charging times and a lack of infrastructure. Elon Musk and Tesla have overcome this with high technology systems and increasing infrastructure of their rapid charging stations. CNG does not share EV's issues with refueling times as a CNG vehicle can be refueled in the same time as diesel and gasoline. However CNG based vehicles face limited infrastructure for refueling and in cases, Montana and parts of the Dakotas, no stations at all. We will take a similar tact and address this issue through the use of technology as well as a campaign to increase availability of CNG stations near areas of interest for our customers.

CNG is not such a new fuel source that it will keep you out of your favorite places for long. After all most major delivery companies have made commitments to change the majority of their trucks to CNG over the next few years. There are currently 964 CNG stations in the United States and Canada with many more planned in the coming months! Check out the Alternative Fuel Data Center for these locations! It is also important to visit CNG Now if you are curious about how the fuel works and to learn more about programs that promote the adoption of this trending fuel.

https://www.afdc.energy.gov/fuels/natural_gas_l...

www.cngnow.com

There is also the challenge of incorporating technology throughout the vehicle and using a majority of sustainable source materials. These aspects are not cheap, and is why many manufacturers have not undertaken this challenge. A significant statement is needed in order to convince our potential business partners to make a transition from their normal inputs to inputs that have less impact on the environment. Help us make this statement by supporting our cause and selecting a donation level below!

Spread the Clean Burn!

We have structured our rewards so everyone can donate to help this concept take flight. The entry level of $5 shows you support this vision of a smart way to RV and helps us showcase our market validation to potential financiers. The other levels give you a reward for your support that is in keeping with our shared values and we hope you really enjoy what we have put together. You may find yourself in a situation where you just can't contribute to our cause, no matter how cool our swag is. That is ok, you can be a great help just by sharing our story with your friends and family! We are all connected to great people that will support this cause as they are able and if we get enough shares and backers we will succeed. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Cliff Notes
Like many of you I have always loved camping and hiking the outdoors, that is partly what drew me to join the Army as a Special Forces recruit back in 2003. I spent a lot of time training in the outdoors with my most memorable trip being to the Yukon in 2008. We arrived at the perfect time and it was still warm enough to bivouac under the stars and northern lights. Oh how the sky danced that night!
As I have aged I have noticed that my ability to find comfort on any surface has been severely diminished. It is also very difficult to pack a family into a bivouac and keep sane! Many of you may be familiar with one of the most important items for military personal as well, communication. I had these elements in mind when I started my search for something better than the simple tent for our outdoor adventures. It was very important for me to meet the goals of sustainability, mobility, connectivity and leisure comfort.
The Recreational Vehicle (RV) has the ability to meet all of these goals as it provides the amenities of climate control, a solid roof over our head, and even a comfy bed. I was all set to find an RV our family likes and then a conflict started in my soul. There was no option that met my goal of sustainability without giving up other aspects of RVing I love like the comfort of indoor leisure space and a full service kitchen. On top of that conflict all the best tech gadgets for RVing had to be added as an aftermarket add-on that created confusion and more work to install. I consider myself pretty handy, having grown up working in the family home construction business, but I didn't want to spend a lot of money on an RV and then spend a lot of time getting it just the way I wanted.
Later that year I started playing hockey on our coed league team, the IceHawks, with some very talented guys that provided some skills I thought were ideal to meet my issues with current RVs head on. Josh is an alternative fuels technician and installs Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) on fleet vehicles and CJ is a mechanic and fabricator with a passion for excellence. Josh's skill in CNG would address the largest part of my sustainability quest by reducing the emissions on the motor that transports the RV to the campsite. CJ's skill in fabrication helped us to dial in our Class A motorhome plans and assists with the technical side of executing our design. 
Our unique and talented team will achieve success in bringing this dream to reality but you can help. Every donation no matter how small will give us fuel to prove to the accelerator we are participating in that we are worthy of further resources. It will also give us confidence that the time and personal resources we are dedicating to this concept is worth the sacrifices we make. If you find yourself wishing you did not have to add aftermarket gadgets to your RV to get it dialed in and wish your RV polluted less and required less maintenance ask yourself this: Can you see your family in a Gäshawk motorhome?
The Journey Matters
We have all heard the phrase but what does it mean. To me it means that we learn incredible amounts of things on our journey that it becomes part of who we are. I had a team member that worked with the fuel I thought would be perfect for a sustainable motorhome but did not know much else about this fuel. We quickly realized this same fuel could also supply fuel to our climate control systems and full service kitchen so we no longer needed to lug around and fuel up a propane tank. Josh educated us on the many benefits of using this clean burning fuel such as we would spend 25% less time and money maintaining the engine because it was so clean burning. CNG fills up at a pump much like gasoline and diesel and fills in roughly the same time so it does not have the issues electric vehicles have. CJ has family that has worked in the RV business for years and we were located 20 miles from the RV capital of the world so we were off and running.
We entered a local competition at the University of Notre Dame called the McCloskey Business Plan competition. This competition provided some great resources and mentors from one of the most prestigious business schools in the nation! The structure of the competition helped us do our first survey and come up with a compelling business plan to reach our goal of building our first prototype. The first thing we learned from this competition is that building a prototype RV is not cheap, we really didn't think it would be but the engineering, possible patent process and time needed to build it out was a daunting mountain laid out before us. We also learned that there were lots  of great ideas coming out of the University of Notre Dame and ours would not make the finals. This would not be my first mountain to climb as I was stationed in Alaska for quite some time and love to hike. We knew we just needed to put one foot in front of the other.
Our survey showed that people generally are open to CNG but are not aware of the availability of this fuel. The great thing is that a lot of people use natural gas in their homes and we can design an RV that fuels up at home. We can also use existing tech to update a navigation system to have all CNG stations plotted on a given route so this would help our target customers find their fuel. A few things were glaringly obvious from our survey; people wanted quality craftsmanship, better internet connectivity, standard tech built into their RV and to spend less time maintaining their RV. This last one should be obvious as we all want to spend more time enjoying the outdoors rather than tinkering on an engine!
We received lots of feedback from our McCloskey mentors that we needed to focus on the luxury RV market and find things to make CNG more "sexy". Not sure what many of you think as I don't find any fuel "sexy" but I had to admit that Tesla sure did make souped up electric cars sexy. A local business owner let me drive his Tesla Model S a few years back and I remembered that experience vividly. This car had handles that popped out when I walked up to it. It unlocked as I grasped the handles and hummed to life as I sat down. The car had a huge display screen with a beautiful backup camera but it also displayed all the systems on an intuitive dashboard. The car vibrated if I got close to the white line on the side of the road and assisted me with every aspect of driving that I could imagine. Oh yeah it also almost made my skin peel off when I stomped on the accelerator when my friend told me to.
This formidable experience with a true luxury car is what inspired our shift from merely a CNG RV to the smart way to RV that we now have in our concept RV. We want to make your experience with our RV last a lifetime and help you juggle your busy family and professional life. We are not reinventing the wheel here, we have just found a better way to turn it. Keep reading to learn more!
Visions of Taking Flight
So you have and overview on why we are undertaking this endeavor but how will it change the landscape of RVs out there on the market. I have been told that the best way to communicate this is to tell a story about our fictional fanatical customer, John. Any similarities to any person living or deceased is purely coincidental.
Our fictional friend is an avid outdoors athlete and travels with his RV to triathlon competitions as well as other sporting venues. John also has a busy day as a fund manager for a large national mutual fund company. story:
EUME - World's First Built-In Back Massaging Backpack

We are constantly on the move, and racing against time. EUME massager backpacks act as a balance to this rush, providing you with the momentary stillness, and revitalization that you deserve. It gives you the power to focus on more important things.

 

The Innovation: World's First Massager Backpacks 

We think that this is one of those "why didn't I think of this before" kind of ideas, and it truly is. Urban mobility luggage solutions are a huge need of the hour. Millions of people around the world use backpacks to store and secure their daily essentials, while others explore the great outdoors with a backpack. Even on a solo trip, the backpack is your true and loyal companion.

How does the Massager Work? 

The massager helps stimulate blood flow, help you relax at your choice of time, and place. You can now enjoy massages on your way to work, and even while hiking.

The massagers activate at the touch of a button, and has 3 modes:

Mode 1: Operates the top massagers 

Mode 2: Operates the lower massagers 

Mode 3: Operates both the massagers

Our Portfolio - Barret Backpack, GenX Backpack, Daily Backpack, and Travel Backpack 

All have the back massager feature + more. You can choose from the Barret Backpack,

or the GenX Backpack, which is perfect for everyday use,

or the Daily Backpack, which is perfect for everyday use,

Or Travel BackPack which is great for travelers.

Designed for Ergonomics and Comfort 

All the Backpacks are designed from the ground up to improve your blood circulation, relax your back, and reduce fatigue through the day. 

Several compartments have been added for better weight distribution, and storage optimization in an intelligent manner. 

The bags are designed to be universal for various heights. Using the height adjustment strap at either side of the bag, the user can align the backpack to their requirements. 

You can adjust the flexible back torso, with the easy straps on the back of the bag. It helps you to align the top massagers and the bottom ones, to support areas where you would like a massage. The primary focus of the adjustment straps is the user's shoulder and lower back.

Built To Carry With Ease

The Challenge of carrying a heavy sling bag or backpack on a daily basis increases the chances of discomfort and back pain. This load over long stretches of time strains your back, and shoulder muscles.

Weight Distribution is key

The form hugs your back, and the straps have been designed to improve your posture, helping you walk straight.

Closer to your spine, to carry it ergonomically (Left- A normal backpack, Right- EUME Daily Pack)

Barret Pack

GenX Backpack

The EUME Classic Pack is the ideal backpack that one can use on a regular basis. The bag consists of anti-theft features, it is water resistant, has optimum storage space and has an inbuilt dual USB port, one which can be used to charge your external device, and the other mini-USB port to charge the power bank placed within, so you can stay away from all the hassle to remove the power bank to charge it before putting it back inside! The backpack with the massaging feature keeps your back relaxed and rejuvenated at all times.

 

Massager height adjusting straps

 The massager adjusting straps ensure that the massager can comfortably be used by people of various heights.

Keep your bag and yourself perfectly organized, ensuring complete efficiency when you dig into your bag to try and find something

Hidden security pockets

 It's water resistant fabric lets you conquer any weather, and it makes sure that all your belongings are safe and secure (and most important dry).

 

 

Daily Pack

EUME Daily Pack

Daily pack Features

 

One major limitation of having a smaller backpack is space. Space limitations, don't let you pack how much you want, and when you try to squeeze a few necessary items into your backpack, the weight of the bag increases, which takes a toll on your back. 

 The EUME daily pack weighs less when compared to other backpacks, and has storage compartments for all your daily necessities.

Minimal sophisticated Design and Cutting edge technology

All your daily accessories, and more fit comfortably in the bag

The Daily pack has an inbuilt USB port, which allows you to seamlessly charge your phone/tablet anywhere, at any time. It also hosts a micro USB port, with lets you simultaneously charge your power bank as well. 

We designed the bag to have a seamless exterior, and a compact footprint, but at the same time the interior of the bag hosts a ton of useful features. 

Daily pack Features

 

 The daily pack provides easy access to all your stuff. The icons on the bag designate where to store things, and the built-in charging system powers up your mobile and tablet. The bag has multiple storage compartments, some of which are hidden for users security purposes.

Loosen your muscles while you're on the go. 

Travel Pack

EUME Travel Pack

The EUME Travel Pack is designed for Travel enthusiasts, who can commute for longer durations without being space constraint. Travel packing systems make packing less of an ordeal. 

Travel pack features

Travel accessories can be comfortably packed in the bag

Ergo support straps

 A lay-flat open design lets the user easily pack their essentials into the travel pack. Intelligently placed support straps, and a convenient side handle makes traveling and carrying around your belongings a breeze.

Travel pack features

Convenient modular pouches make packing less of a hassle. They allow you to make better use of the bag's space, so you can fit more into your bag, while the items are better protected. 

Unlike the Barret, GenX and daily pack, which has a laptop and tablet compartment, the EUME travel pack has a detachable electronic sleeve, that houses your laptop, tablet, chargers, and a book.

The pouches can be easily stacked inside the bag, and because of the shape is given to them, there are barely any awkward gaps. The symbol on each organizer makes it easy for the traveler to pack their belongings in the designated pouches. 

The detachable electronic sleeve in the travel pack is designed such that you don't need to lug your bag around everywhere. You can conveniently carry only your electronic devices in the sleeve, and leave the bag behind.

Travel Bag Accessories Video

 

Design ​

Common Features of the Backpack

Daily Backpack and Travel pack share some incredible features

 Convenience

Never run out of charge

Comparison chart

 

Tag a friend, family member or coworker who need this! Don't keep it a secret. Share the campaign by clicking any social media icons on the top of the page.

 

SHIPPING

 

We ship worldwide. Prices mentioned in perk exclude any local duties. USA & CANADA backers will not have to pay any duties.

Our plan is to ship products in July 2019.

Become a backer of the project, you'll get to own EUME at an exclusive price. We will provide you update on a regular basis via the campaign page update tab.

Please check our FAQ page for more information. Still have a question? Send an email at info@eumeworld.com

Thank you for your support!

This load over long stretches of time strains your back, and shoulder muscles.Weight Distribution is key The form hugs your back, and the straps have been designed to improve your posture, helping you walk straight.Closer to your spine, to carry it ergonomically (Left- A normal backpack, Right- EUME Daily Pack)Barret PackGenX BackpackThe EUME Classic Pack is the ideal backpack that one can use on a regular basis. The bag consists of anti-theft features, it is water resistant, has optimum storage space and has an inbuilt dual USB port, one which can be used to charge your external device, and the other mini-USB port to charge the power bank placed within, so you can stay away from all the hassle to remove the power bank to charge it before putting it back inside! The backpack with the massaging feature keeps your back relaxed and rejuvenated at all times. Massager height adjusting straps The massager adjusting straps ensure that the massager can comfortably be used by people of various heights.Keep your bag and yourself perfectly organized, ensuring complete efficiency when you dig into your bag to try and find somethingHidden security pockets It's water resistant fabric lets you conquer any weather, and it makes sure that all your belongings are safe and secure (and most important dry).  Daily PackEUME Daily PackDaily pack Features  One major limitation of having a smaller backpack is space. Space limitations, don't let you pack how much you want, and when you try to squeeze a few necessary items into your backpack, the weight of the bag increases, which takes a toll on your back.  The EUME daily pack weighs less when compared to other backpacks, and has storage compartments for all your daily necessities.Minimal sophisticated Design and Cutting edge technologyAll your daily accessories, and more fit comfortably in the bag The Daily pack has an inbuilt USB port, which allows you to seamlessly charge your phone/tablet anywhere, at any time. It also hosts a micro USB port, with lets you simultaneously charge your power bank as well. We designed the bag to have a seamless exterior, and a compact footprint, but at the same time the interior of the bag hosts a ton of useful features. Daily pack Features  The daily pack provides easy access to all your stuff. The icons on the bag designate where to store things, and the built-in charging system powers up your mobile and tablet. The bag has multiple storage compartments, some of which are hidden for users security purposes.Loosen your muscles while you're on the go. Travel PackEUME Travel PackThe EUME Travel Pack is designed for Travel enthusiasts, who can commute for longer durations without being space constraint. Travel packing systems make packing less of an ordeal. Travel pack featuresTravel accessories can be comfortably packed in the bag Ergo support straps  A lay-flat open design lets the user easily pack their essentials into the travel pack. Intelligently placed support straps, and a convenient side handle makes traveling and carrying around your belongings a breeze.Travel pack featuresConvenient modular pouches make packing less of a hassle. They allow you to make better use of the bag's space, so you can fit more into your bag, while the items are better protected. Unlike the Barret, GenX and daily pack, which has a laptop and tablet compartment, the EUME travel pack has a detachable electronic sleeve, that houses your laptop, tablet, chargers, and a book.The pouches can be easily stacked inside the bag, and because of the shape is given to them, there are barely any awkward gaps. The symbol on each organizer makes it easy for the traveler to pack their belongings in the designated pouches. The detachable electronic sleeve in the travel pack is designed such that you don't need to lug your bag around everywhere. You can conveniently carry only your electronic devices in the sleeve, and leave the bag behind.Travel Bag Accessories Video Design ​Common Features of the BackpackDaily Backpack and Travel pack share some incredible features Convenience Never run out of charge Comparison chart Tag a friend, family member or coworker who need this! Don't keep it a secret. Share the campaign by clicking any social media icons on the top of the page. SHIPPING We ship worldwide. Prices mentioned in perk exclude any local duties. USA & CANADA backers will not have to pay any duties.Our plan is to ship products in July 2019.Become a backer of the project, you'll get to own EUME at an exclusive price. We will provide you update on a regular basis via the campaign page update tab.Please check our FAQ page for more information. Still have a question? Send an email at info@eumeworld.comThank you for your support!

story:
Vulcan Tourism and Trek station is very unique. It’s not like any other Visitor Information Center. In addition to being a Visitor Information Centre open all year round, we have gone with the Star Trek theme here and through our town of Vulcan. If you have ever been to our town you will have seen our Star ship Enterprise FX6-1995-A on Highway 23 at the entrance to our town, our space station shaped tourist information centre, replica captain's chair and our shuttle craft. We have a collection of Star Trek memorabilia on display of items that a special Trekkie collected through the years and donated to our centre upon his passing.

Our gift shop is unique in that we design, produce and sell our own line of Star Trek gifts that are exclusive to Vulcan Tourism and can only be purchased from us! The money from the gift shop sales are also used to supplement the funding of the Tourism Society in Vulcan.

Our cheerful staff are always willing to help answer questions - whatever they may be! Devan Daniels (Tourism Administrator), Shannon Clarke (Assistant Administrator) and of course our Travel Counsellors Karen, Carlie and Connor!

Over the years, Vulcan Tourism has been successful in hosting an annual festival now known as Spock Days. Each June we host our very own convention and bring up celebrities from Star Trek series and movies as guests. They ride in the lead cars during our Spock Days parade, sign autographs, take pictures with you, and give question and answer sessions. In addition we have a dinner and dance and the town hosts a family fun festival as well with entertainment and fun for the whole family! Spock Days takes place each June.

The Starship replica on the highway was built in 1995 and our tourism centre opened year round in October 1998.  Leonard Nimoy graced us with his presence in 2010 when he visited for the unveiling of Mr. Spock's Bust in our town centre along with Leonard Nimoy's handprint cast in bronze.

FUNDING

Funding for the Tourism Centre is provided by the Town of Vulcan and Vulcan County. We supplement that funding with our gift shop sales. We also apply for government grants to assist us with the costs necessary to perform all the needed functions Vulcan Tourism is supposed to oversee. With funding cuts everywhere, grants are not as easy to come by and all we are left with is enough funding to pay the wages for the centre for the year, a small amount of advertising and little else.

We usually obtain a grant to assist us with temporary summer employment so that we may hire the staff needed for our 15,000 travellers every year. This year, however, we did not receive any grants to hire summer help due to the fact our provincial government cancelled their grant program putting more pressure on the federal grant program.

This year, sadly, Southern Alberta was hit with a disaster. Severe flooding affected many communities in late June. People lost their entire homes. HIghways and roads were washed out. An entire town of 12,000 had to be evacuated. Tourists were unable to enjoy Southern Alberta for many weeks. This affected our visitorship and the amount of money tourists were spending. Many people simply stayed home and used their resources to help their friends, families and even strangers!  Who could blame them?!!

As a result of all this, our gift shop sales have suffered putting an extra strain on the budget.

There are many things Vulcan Tourism is mandated to do.

We need to design, implement and promote new tourism initiatives for our town and county.

We need to work with neighbouring counties to promote tourism throughout Alberta.

We need to keep our Spock Days festival on track and be able to financially support it.

We need to design, implement and promote community events.

As of present date this year, we have received no government funding. These usually help with the costs of summer staff. With extra summer staff we could have provided a summer camp for preschool and elementary school children.

Without proper funding and staffing, we have to close the Tourism and Trek Station while we are go on conferences, comic cons and training days or to meet with our counterparts in other jurisdictions. Extra funding would provide us with more time for planning tours and day trips within our county and town. New attractions could be added and a community events calendar could be promoted.

With more money we could better advertise our special town and Spock Days weekend which happens annually every second weekend in June. As you might already know getting celebrities is expensive. Talent can cost anywhere from $5,000 to $100,000 plus flights and travel expenses per person! Otherwise we have to bring back repeat celebrities or "B"  talent. That doesn't always bring back the fans, but if we bring the right person or persons and with the proper advertising, we can improve attendance levels which will increase the economic spinoff.

We would like to raise money for operating costs (30k), and money to book talent for 2014 Spock Days (25k).  We would very much like to Keep one summer staff member for the whole year (15k). We need extra funding to design and implement new tours, community events such as a kid’s science camp (10k), attractions such as refurbishing of the shuttle craft (20 k), and update and maintain the inside of our Trek Station. We would love to have something new for repeat visitors to come and see. We would like to add a Fan Art section that would see art created by the fans on display. The fans' names would be on display and we would showcase the talent of the fans from all over the world! This display could be changed out annually to give other fans an opportunity to have their works on display. We also would like to design a new photo opportunity in our replica Captain's chair. We would also increase the space allocated to community news where each town, village and hamlet in our county would have their own space to advertise all their events. It would be wonderful if we had the money to advertise all these fun things and to improve our revenues.

 

 Photo from Spock Days 2013

story:
Hooray! We Won The GOOD DESIGN AWARD 2017!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

   

 

 

 

 

 

 

Before(Produced without internal stiffeners)

 After(Produced with internal stiffeners)

At K, we start with consumer research to develop products that people want and need. We are always working to provide the most intimate and comfortable experience for people to use in their everyday life.  

Creation Process

 

 

Korin x CES 2017

First there was ClickPack 1.0. Creators showed the pack at CES2017, collected feedback, went back to the lab, and upgraded the design. The ClickPack Pro was born！

 

  

About us

 
K Brand introduction
The Brand: K  
Our mission is to help travelers have a sense of security. K symbolizes the spirit of innovation, perseverance and courage.  
Our product is people-oriented—from the system of “Click anti-theft” to EasyCharging patented technology, a scientifically engineered storage system and full protection for electronic devices.    
When designing, we believe function dictates form. We insist on using innovative material appropriately and unique cutting-edge techniques to make our product look simple yet stylish.
 
 
 
About our designers
   
 
The design team is led by Vlad V. The team specializes in providing innovative solutions for users of 3C electronic products, fashion products and intelligent equipment companies. We have been recipient of the Germany IF Award, Red Dot Award and more than 40 international design awards. We have created and designed for varied enterprises from consumer research and product-line planning to the integrated service model of market introduction design.
 

Commitment and reward 

 

 

 

Why Crowdfunding?  

When travel and commerce are a part of your daily life, you may concern yourself with someone stealing your belongings, your phone running out of juice, or forgetting where you put certain must-have items within your bag. Our team has also had these experiences, and we spent an entire year to study the way people travel. We designed the ClickPack Anti-theft Backpack as a result to combine “security, storage, convenience, comfort and beauty. We would like to use the crowdfunding platform to share this amazing innovation so that more people can enjoy the pleasure of travel and a better lifestyle.

story:
FLUX is an original design that represents another first for Torch and safety apparel. This is important for us at Torch because it demonstrates that we are much more than a bicycle helmet company. We are a young brand focused on creating stylish products with active safety lights that are unlike anything else on the market.

FLUX is available in two color options:

  • Black shell with black bindings, red panel and red vinyl interior
  • Red shell with black bindings, red panel and grey vinyl interior




Operating the lights is easy with the integrated shoulder strap button. The button includes an internal light that will indicate which light function is chosen so you can operate the lights while wearing the bag.


       

The light from the LEDs is evenly dispersed using a 1mm thick fiber optic assembly. The fiber optics are waterproof, flexible and will last the lifetime of the backpack. The USB rechargeable light unit is easily removed for recharging or for cleaning of the bag.

FLUX is a full-size 29 Liter bag that is capable of holding everything you need and make sure that it stays dry. The interior is fully lined with a tarpaulin vinyl lining with woven core to resist tears. 




The wide top opening makes it easy to access items in the main compartment.




The fold top gives FLUX a classic messenger style while offering the same waterproof closure as a typical roll-top backpack and it's 1000 denier nylon outer and vinyl tarpaulin interior make this bag absolutely waterproof.






Torch is a brand created, owned, and operated by real outdoor enthusiasts who enjoy riding, hiking, running, even motorcycling. We are very proud of our previous Indiegogo and crowdfunding beginnings and thankful for all of our supporters and the value and validity you continue to bring to Torch.



The funds we raise will go towards paying our minimum order that is required with our suppliers. If we meet our goal then we will be able to place the minimum order with our suppliers, but if we are able to over fund, then it will allow us to expand our color options and possibly improve our delivery time.

Torch is no stranger to crowdfunding. We've run two previous successful campaigns during the development of our T1 and T2 bike helmets. We know what it takes to get products to market and feel very confident that we have completed everything necessary to make sure that FLUX is production ready. 

Your reward for supporting Torch will not only be one of the first FLUX backpacks available, but the fact that you helped make it possible. Bringing a new product to market takes an enormous amount of effort and resources so your support is very important to us as a young and growing brand. Making this product available will add a new level of safety and style for all of us outdoor enthusiasts and we're hoping that it will start a trend for others to follow in creating better safety options.


There are very few risks for this project. Unlike our helmet which was required to meet very strict safety standards in order for us to be able to deliver it, FLUX must only surpass standard manufacturing tests such as testing of the circuit board, battery, and material safety standards for flammability for the fabrics and our suppliers exceed all of these standards. 

Being that this is a new product with a new set of suppliers for Torch there is always room for error. Should we run into any troubles along the way, we will be quick to inform everyone who has supported the project and explain how we will surpass any challenges and what effects they may have on our expected delivery date. 



Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Follow us on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools below to share with your friends!

story:
The pocket knife is an essential everyday tool. While its utility may vary depending on who you are and what you do, it's one trusty companion that'll make quick work of the day's unexpected tasks, both big and small. Those of you that carry one know what I'm talking about.

With my first standard size pocket knife design, the goal was to create a knife that had the versatility to slice through various tasks. Such a tool would accompany you on your day's journey, so the knife had to be both compact and well-built for reliability and resilience. Last but not least, my goal was to design a knife that just plain looked good—something your friend or a curious stranger would stop to ask you about. Thus, the Strand & the West was born.

Following the success of my previous projects, I received many requests to make a bigger pocket knife to which I said "Let's do it!" After many painstaking months, I present to you two new knives: the Strand with a frame lock, and the West with a slip joint design (non-locking). Both of these pocket knives are bigger than the previous designs, yet abide by the same principles of portability, a solid and reliable construction, and a refined visual aesthetic.

 Although they are the perfect size to clip in your pocket discreetly these folding knives are made to be seen. With a balanced design and visual appeal the comfort of the knives was not overlooked.

An everyday carry tool needs to be able to withstand your everyday grind, so we’ve built these knives out of some tough materials.

The body is made of Grade 5 Titanium, a metal known for its strength and minimal weight. The blade is made of hardened D2 Steel, known for its sharpness and toughness.  Every component is made with the tightest tolerances, resulting in a strong, sturdy, and lightweight knife that is made to do work. Not to mention the look and feel of these knives are fantastic.

1) The Strand is a frame lock design with a blade that is 2.8 inches, housed in a sturdy titanium frame. A great everyday carry and camping knife. Weight is 3.2 oz. 

The Strand Body

Meticulously machined titanium with smooth beveled edges that feel great in the hand 

Ergonomic notch in the handle has been placed at an optimal distance to double as a grip. Your index finger fits nicely in the groove

The blade has a strong lock that can endure substantial pressure

Smooth one handed opening action

Easy lock bar release when closing, comes with a stainless steel lock bar insert

Comes with a stainless steel ball detent

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS:

Blade Length: 2.8 inches 

Blade Thickness: .129 inches 

Body Length: 3.9 inches 

Open Length: 6.7 inches 

Blade Type: Clip Point 

Blade Grind: Hollow

Blade Steel: D2 Steel 

Body Type: Grade 5/6AL 4V Titanium 

Hardware: 416 Stainless Steel 

Washers: Phosphor bronze

Weight: 3.2 oz

2) The West is the slip joint design that does not lock. Its length is 3.5 inches closed with a blade that is 2.5 inches. For the international backers, this one maybe for you (legal in almost all countries). Weight is 1.9 oz.

The West Body

Meticulously Machined Titanium with smooth beveled edges that feel great in the hand.

Ergonomic notch in the handle has been placed at an optimal distance to pull the blade out and double as a grip. Your middle finger fits nicely in the groove.

The blade does not lock but has a very strong spring to hold the blade in place in the open position. A few extra steps are done such as heat treating and clamping in order to get a strong lever spring tension and a perfect fit. 

It is common to see small slip joint knives without pocket clips but for me a pocket clip is a must. The pocket clip allows the knife to ride securely in your pocket while feeling practically weightless. 

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS:

Blade Length: 2.5 inches 

Blade Thickness: .118 inches

Body Length: 3.5 inches 

Open Length: 6 inches 

Blade Type: Clip point 

Blade Grind: Hollow

Blade Steel: D2 Steel 

Body Type: Grade 5/6AL 4V Titanium 

Hardware: 416 stainless steel 

Washers: Phosphor bronze

Weight: 1.9 oz

Blades

Blades are made with D2 steel. We choose this steel because it is a very tough steel that will stay sharp with daily use. It has excellent wear resistance and great edge retention.

The shape of these blades are made to be versatile and very practical. Made to be highly functional, with both cutting and detailed work in mind.

Made with hardened D2 steel at 58-60HRC. In addition it will go through a cryogenic process which removes residual stresses and improves wear resistance. Comes with a hollow grind and very sharp right out of the box.

Quality

These knives are custom manufactured, meticulously machined, with top quality finishes. The 416 stainless steel pivot allows for a lifetime of use. 

Durability

The bodies are made of titanium that is strong and lightweight. Extremely durable with a blade that is tough as nails. Simply put, these knives are made to last. 

THE STRAND & THE WEST COME WITH A LIFETIME WARRANTY!

 

Comfort

Robust yet still compact and light 

 Simple clean design with just the right amount of ergonomics to fit nicely in your hand

 Extra machining on the edges for the ultra round smooth corners to ensure comfort and minimizes wear on pockets 

Pocket clip goes unnoticed when gripping the handle

 Practicality

Adds a productive tool to your everyday carry. Use it to open boxes or anything that requires more effort than your fingers. Cut, chop and slice almost anything. Flip out the blade for instant access in time of need. It is a handy tool and satisfying to use. You will soon discover it to be an essential part of your everyday carry. The Strand & the West is designed to be a basic knife with a versatile do-everything blade that just happens to be housed in a simple eye catching handle. No unnecessary add-ons, the single blade simply acts as your trusty sidekick in everyday life.

Why do you need a pocket knife?

How many times have you been in a situation where you’ve said to yourself, “Heck, a knife would be really handy now!” A pocket knife is a handy tool for light to medium work and makes simple things in life more enjoyable!

Finish Choices for The Strand: 

Black PVD (smooth satin black)

Bead Blasted (textured grey- aids in grip)

Stone Washed (small marking pattern)

Satin Finish (smooth finish)

Finish choices for The West:

Black PVD (smooth satin black)

Bead Blasted (textured grey- aids in grip)

Satin Finish (smooth finish)

Please note: Stone Washed finish is not available for the West

The Strand (The Larger Frame Lock)

Kickstarter Early Bird Price $89 

Kickstarter Standard Price $99 

If they are available after Kickstarter Retail Price will be $160.

The West (The Smaller Slip Joint Knife)

Kickstarter Early Bird Price $69

Kickstarter Standard Price $79 

If they are available after Kickstarter Retail Price will be $130.

These are exclusive Kickstarter prices and heavily discounted in order to get the Strand & the West into as many hands as possible. I want you to see the quality first hand!

THE STRAND & THE WEST COME WITH A LIFETIME WARRANTY!

 

Invest in a knife that you are proud to show off, is comfortable in your pocket, and one that reflects your personality. A pocket knife that feels good in the hand, that you’ll take pride in and want to carry around, plus won’t break the bank. 

Follow us on instagram for additional photos.

Production

We are currently in process of manufacturing the Strand & West and offering it at a discounted price before they hit our retail shop at www.quietcarry.com. I would like to get the Strand & West in as many hands as possible so you can see the quality first hand and second to get our manufacturing cost down to pass on these savings. I am really excited for the future of the company and The Strand & West knife. If you have any questions don't hesitate to contact me here or at info@quietcarry.com. Thank you for your continued support! - Bryce
story_txt: The pocket knife is an essential everyday tool. While its utility may vary depending on who you are and what you do, it's one trusty companion that'll make quick work of the day's unexpected tasks, both big and small. Those of you that carry one know what I'm talking about.With my first standard size pocket knife design, the goal was to create a knife that had the versatility to slice through various tasks. Such a tool would accompany you on your day's journey, so the knife had to be both compact and well-built for reliability and resilience. Last but not least, my goal was to design a knife that just plain looked good—something your friend or a curious stranger would stop to ask you about. Thus, the Strand & the West was born.Following the success of my previous projects, I received many requests to make a bigger pocket knife to which I said "Let's do it!" After many painstaking months, I present to you two new knives: the Strand with a frame lock, and the West with a slip joint design (non-locking). Both of these pocket knives are bigger than the previous designs, yet abide by the same principles of portability, a solid and reliable construction, and a refined visual aesthetic. Although they are the perfect size to clip in your pocket discreetly these folding knives are made to be seen. With a balanced design and visual appeal the comfort of the knives was not overlooked.An everyday carry tool needs to be able to withstand your everyday grind, so we’ve built these knives out of some tough materials.The body is made of Grade 5 Titanium, a metal known for its strength and minimal weight. The blade is made of hardened D2 Steel, known for its sharpness and toughness.  Every component is made with the tightest tolerances, resulting in a strong, sturdy, and lightweight knife that is made to do work. Not to mention the look and feel of these knives are fantastic.1) The Strand is a frame lock design with a blade that is 2.8 inches, housed in a sturdy titanium frame. A great everyday carry and camping knife. Weight is 3.2 oz. The Strand BodyMeticulously machined titanium with smooth beveled edges that feel great in the hand Ergonomic notch in the handle has been placed at an optimal distance to double as a grip. Your index finger fits nicely in the grooveThe blade has a strong lock that can endure substantial pressureSmooth one handed opening actionEasy lock bar release when closing, comes with a stainless steel lock bar insertComes with a stainless steel ball detentTECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS:Blade Length: 2.8 inches Blade Thickness: .129 inches Body Length: 3.9 inches Open Length: 6.7 inches Blade Type: Clip Point Blade Grind: HollowBlade Steel: D2 Steel Body Type: Grade 5/6AL 4V Titanium Hardware: 416 Stainless Steel Washers: Phosphor bronzeWeight: 3.2 oz2) The West is the slip joint design that does not lock. Its length is 3.5 inches closed with a blade that is 2.5 inches. For the international backers, this one maybe for you (legal in almost all countries). Weight is 1.9 oz.The West BodyMeticulously Machined Titanium with smooth beveled edges that feel great in the hand.Ergonomic notch in the handle has been placed at an optimal distance to pull the blade out and double as a grip. Your middle finger fits nicely in the groove.The blade does not lock but has a very strong spring to hold the blade in place in the open position. A few extra steps are done such as heat treating and clamping in order to get a strong lever spring tension and a perfect fit. It is common to see small slip joint knives without pocket clips but for me a pocket clip is a must. The pocket clip allows the knife to ride securely in your pocket while feeling practically weightless. TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS:Blade Length: 2.5 inches Blade Thickness: .118 inchesBody Length: 3.5 inches Open Length: 6 inches Blade Type: Clip point Blade Grind: HollowBlade Steel: D2 Steel Body Type: Grade 5/6AL 4V Titanium Hardware: 416 stainless steel Washers: Phosphor bronzeWeight: 1.9 ozBladesBlades are made with D2 steel. We choose this steel because it is a very tough steel that will stay sharp with daily use. It has excellent wear resistance and great edge retention.The shape of these blades are made to be versatile and very practical. Made to be highly functional, with both cutting and detailed work in mind.Made with hardened D2 steel at 58-60HRC. In addition it will go through a cryogenic process which removes residual stresses and improves wear resistance. Comes with a hollow grind and very sharp right out of the box.QualityThese knives are custom manufactured, meticulously machined, with top quality finishes. The 416 stainless steel pivot allows for a lifetime of use. DurabilityThe bodies are made of titanium that is strong and lightweight. Extremely durable with a blade that is tough as nails. Simply put, these knives are made to last. THE STRAND & THE WEST COME WITH A LIFETIME WARRANTY! ComfortRobust yet still compact and light  Simple clean design with just the right amount of ergonomics to fit nicely in your hand Extra machining on the edges for the ultra round smooth corners to ensure comfort and minimizes wear on pockets Pocket clip goes unnoticed when gripping the handle PracticalityAdds a productive tool to your everyday carry. Use it to open boxes or anything that requires more effort than your fingers. Cut, chop and slice almost anything. Flip out the blade for instant access in time of need. It is a handy tool and satisfying to use. You will soon discover it to be an essential part of your everyday carry. The Strand & the West is designed to be a basic knife with a versatile do-everything blade that just happens to be housed in a simple eye catching handle. No unnecessary add-ons, the single blade simply acts as your trusty sidekick in everyday life.Why do you need a pocket knife?How many times have you been in a situation where you’ve said to yourself, “Heck, a knife would be really handy now!” A pocket knife is a handy tool for light to medium work and makes simple things in life more enjoyable!Finish Choices for The Strand: Black PVD (smooth satin black)Bead Blasted (textured grey- aids in grip)Stone Washed (small marking pattern)Satin Finish (smooth finish)Finish choices for The West:Black PVD (smooth satin black)Bead Blasted (textured grey- aids in grip)Satin Finish (smooth finish)Please note: Stone Washed finish is not available for the WestThe Strand (The Larger Frame Lock)Kickstarter Early Bird Price $89 Kickstarter Standard Price $99 If they are available after Kickstarter Retail Price will be $160.The West (The Smaller Slip Joint Knife)Kickstarter Early Bird Price $69Kickstarter Standard Price $79 If they are available after Kickstarter Retail Price will be $130.These are exclusive Kickstarter prices and heavily discounted in order to get the Strand & the West into as many hands as possible. I want you to see the quality first hand!THE STRAND & THE WEST COME WITH A LIFETIME WARRANTY! Invest in a knife that you are proud to show off, is comfortable in your pocket, and one that reflects your personality. A pocket knife that feels good in the hand, that you’ll take pride in and want to carry around, plus won’t break the bank. Follow us on instagram for additional photos.ProductionWe are currently in process of manufacturing the Strand & West and offering it at a discounted price before they hit our retail shop at www.quietcarry.com. I would like to get the Strand & West in as many hands as possible so you can see the quality first hand and second to get our manufacturing cost down to pass on these savings. I am really excited for the future of the company and The Strand & West knife. If you have any questions don't hesitate to contact me here or at info@quietcarry.com. Thank you for your continued support! - Bryce

story:
This is the main purpose of the Trinity Set – to transport your violin and bows safely through the check-in procedure, without any discussions with flight personnel and the airline's one-piece-cabin-luggage-only -policy, buying extra seats etc. Just wheel it onboard, without anybody noticing that you are even travelling with an instrument! Onboard - remove the BowCase and place it next to the SuitCase in the overhead locker.



The Trinity SuitCase also gives you plenty of space for your documents, computer, book, cosmetics, music, concert clothes and shoes. All that in one piece of cabin luggage of an adjustable size, within the size limits of virtually all the airlines. No need to check-in your computer, and no risk of standing on a concert podium without your concert dress.


Trinity ViolinCase


Trinity ViolinCase is made of hyper-modern composite materials (carbon and glass fibers)

The composite shell can withstand substantial weight. 


This sandwich structure is extremely resilient to any impact.


Trinity ViolinCase uses a strong external lock which both prevents an unauthorized opening and secures the whole case by fixing it to a firm object. 




The inside is covered with soft, insulating and lightweight polyester fleece. Elastic pillows keep the instrument gently but firmly in place. 

Additional structural reinforcements support the vault and ensure a supreme side impact protection : 2 interconnecting pillars on both sides of  a violin,  a full-height partition around the violin neck, virtually indestructible nylon hinges.


Trinity BowCase


The standard shell is made of robust ABS-plastic, reinforced with an aluminum&glass-fiber “spine”.

We offer versions in  glass fiber, carbon fiber and jute as well, also in shorter version (to be used only with the ViolinCase). These are even more attractive and more resilient to impact.

An external soft cover acts as an extra impact, scratch and heat shield. It can be securely attached to the Trinity ViolinCase. The detachable pockets (optional) offer space for a shoulder rest, Kensington retractable cable lock and other items (glasses, pencil etc).


The Trinity BowCase (without its soft cover) is used for leading the SuitCase.  Slide it into the channel, until you hear the click.

You can lead the SuitCase (with the Trinity ViolinCase inside) through the gate at the airport like any other passenger. 


Trinity SuitCase


2 versions of Trinity SuitCase


Trinity SuitCase with a traditional expandable lid has 2 outer pockets large enough for a 13’’ computer and 2 inner net-pockets. You can vary the thickness of your SuitCase between 20 and 25 cm.

Trinity SuitCase with a detachable lid is another unique solution by String King. You can detach the lid and turn it into a shoulder bag in seconds (the separate shoulder strap is provided). You can leave the SuitCase at the hotel and carry the bag with all the stuff you may need. It’s great for every-day use too.


You can secure the Trinity SuitCase to any solid object (like a shelf in the train) in a similar way as 2 other cases of the Trinity Set - by using the same  Kensington Click-Safe Lock Wire(optional). 

Simultaneously you can secure the BowCase - pull the Kensington lock wire through the loop and click it on the SuitCase. It is possible to secure even the entire Trinity Set.


If you want to have even better suspension you can add our ownSpring Suspension System (SSS) (available as a perk).The wheels will damp vibrations a bit like in a car.


You can find much more information about the Trinity Travel Set on our website: www.trinitycase.com >> Click here to open in a new tab <<


PERKS

We offer many unique perks and all are made by String King. Some of them (like the Violin Emergency Clamp) can be used by all the violinists. Others, like Mutey or Peggy will work for violin and viola players (both historical and modern instruments). Wrist warmers are perfect for everybody playing in freezing conditions. You can find all the perks with detail descriptions HERE.        




MORE INFORMATION ABOUT OUR PERKS - CLICK HERE!






We were working on the Trinity Set for the last 3 years and we have made already several cases (with the financial help of Swedish state fund). We are testing them extensively and still improving them.  Now we need to make the first proper series. Still, we are not talking about a mass production and ordering vast quantities of cases in China; we make almost everything ourselves. Our products combine modern technologies with a genuine handwork. Thanks to the 3D-printers and CNC (computerized numerical control) machines we can create our own parts and details and even manufacture them. 

To be able to do it on a bigger scale we need your help to invest in our own machinery and production materials and to order larger amount of the tissue covers for the SuitCase and the BowCase elsewhere.

We need 30,000$ for making the first 50  Trinity sets.

We offer you many original perks (rewards). The greatest perks though are the Trinity Cases themselves. You can get the world's smallest and strongest ViolinCase, combine it with the BowCase or ultimately hide it in the SuitCase and save about 20% compared to the future retail price. 

In case we don’t reach our goal, your money will not be wasted - we just have to spend more of our own funds and it may take a bit longer time. 

The aim of this campaign, besides financing of manufacturing this first series, is spreading the news about this unique and unconsciously long awaited products, They are not directed to the general public, but to the very specific group of users - musicians who have to fly with their instruments and often encounter problems at the airport. Not a fancy design, but functionality, reliability and protection were our priorities, while different gadgets were not (you can put any electronics in our SuitCase too). Your contribution will help bringing these highly needed products sooner to yourself and other violinist in the whole world.  

This is not the first (nor last) invention or unique product by String King, but this is the first one on such a technological and economical scale, and this is the reason we have decided that crowd funding was the right way to go. String King creates products for a very specialized market with potential customers spread all over the world, and that’s why we are committed to building a long-time relation to all our clients - we want them to visit our web shop and they can come back to us with any problems and needs they may have. String King is not just a one-product company. 

This project has passed the idea stadium long time ago. He have developed our own technological know-how and certain production capacity and we cooperate with only very few, reliable suppliers. We have made plenty of prototypes and versions and tested them thoroughly. We still make some minor changes and improvements but we don’t expect any major obstacles to come in our way. What we need now is the financial investment and the increase of our production capacity - here we need YOUR help.

Even if you don’t need any of Trinity Set’s cases but like the idea, you may support us choosing one of our smaller perks. They may be useful for yourself, or as an original present. If you can’t help us financially, we would appreciate very much if you could spread the word about Trinity Violin Travel Set and about this campaign to others, who could be interested. The easiest way to do that is to use Indiegogo share tools.

FAQ

How is it possible to hide the bows in the cabin size luggage?
It's little "tricky", but by placing them in our specially designed BowCase, serving as the leading handle of the Trinity SuitCase, you can "drive-in" onboard like an ordinary passenger with a wheeled suitcase. Onboard you remove the BowCase from the SuitCase and place it separately in a head locker. 

Can I use the Trinity SuitCase as a cabin luggage for all the airlines?
Yes, the SuitCase can be used with all the major airlines. There are some exceptions, like some local companies flying to smaller destinations, islands etc. Sometimes you have to leave even a cabin-size suitcase when boarding a big plane  (if there is too much hand luggage onboard). In such a situation you can just take the ViolinCase and the BowCase (possibly with the addition of our detachable lid of the SuitCase) bringing all the important objects with you into the plane. 
When you travel with many American Airlines, KLM, AirFrance for instance you leave the side pockets empty and fill the top pockets up to 23 or 25 cm total thicknesses. When you travel with Ryanair or Lufthansa you can fill the side pockets slightly and with Easy Jet or British Airways you can pack all the pockets to maximum.

Do you have a guarantee? 
We give lifetime guarantee for the composite shells and for other parts and details we give 3 years guarantee. Just make photo of the damaged part and we will send it to you. Almost all the parts are easy to exchange with a help of simple tools. 

Can I choose my material and color?
You can choose the outer layer of the composite shell. There is a natural carbon fiber surface. It can be painted in any color (optional). The jute outside layer can be natural brownish or dark red. In the future more colors of jute will be available, as will be a leather covered version. 
At the inside the standard solution is the grey fleece with leather cushions and details in several colors (black, dark brown, light brown, red). We offer as well several other colors, as you can see on our photos. We combine super-soft minky fleece and ordinary fleece. 

Is it possible to use the case with a chinrest on the violin?

Yes, there is space inside for any model of chinrest.


Shipping?
We'll start shipping at the end of May 2016. We'll keep you updated.

Can you ship to different countries?
Yes, but please be aware of the specific import taxes and tariffs of the country you live in.

Can I choose the material and outer finish of the BowCase?

The standard shell is made of ABS-plastic, but you can also choose even stronger (more resilient to an impact) and more attractive composite finishes in silver-glass fiber, carbon fiber and natural jute fiber (paying a smaller supplement). 

There is something to consider, if you like the jute surface. This BowCase looks much less ”technical” at the airport, so it may attract some attention from the personal at the gate and it’s usually better to avoid it. 

The carbon or glass fiber BowCase looks much more like an ordinary suitcase handle.  

If you don’t plan to use the BowCase with the SuitCase, the jute finish is the beautiful choice. You may also order a slightly shorter version of the composite BowCase (without the detachable SuitCase handle option).

The jute cases are slightly heavier than carbon fiber cases (jute fibers absorb more resin).  

Can I combine the composite BowCase with the soft cover?

Yes, you can, but you may think it would be a pity to hide such a beautiful BowCase. You can use it ”naked” on the top of the ViolinCase using straps (optional), where you can attach the supplementary accessory pockets (for your shoulder rest , etc.) (there is a space for a rosin and strings inside the ViolinCase).
