story:
Hi, my name is Connie and I want to raise money to send my boyfriend and I on a trip around Europe. Student life can be hard, as my boyfriend and I have only very recently found out – studying, social life, making living affordable – you get the idea. Although many people will endure these difficult times, some will find themselves suffering a lot more than most. One of these people I believe is my boyfriend of 7 years. We came from very different backgrounds, him and me. He came from a poor background in a relatively rough part of our city, with no educational aspirations or encouragement from his family. He agreed that he was to be destined to sign on to the dole. After we started talking, getting to know each other and seeing how each other lived, I tried to help him understand that he could achieve more in life than he thought he could. He soon found he had talent in music, soon became enthusiastic about design, and by the end of school he left with far better grades than most. I was so proud of him, and still am to this day. At the age of 18, only months after leaving school, we started university – he is studying design and myself nursing. We had plans to take a gap year after year 2 of uni to travel across Europe, which we put a lot of time and effort into planning. Everything was going well, until he suddenly lost his both of his grandfathers, one to a stroke and the other to a heart attack, and his own father suffered from other sudden heart issues. Needless to say this left a significant impact on him, and it was very noticeable to me. He was always a bit of a hypochondriac, but with all these things happening around him, it began to feel much more real to him. He was diagnosed with severe anxiety and depression 2 years ago now, during which time he has become quiet, introverted and even afraid of going outside the house. I myself suffered from this in the past, and know how he feels. After seeing him do so well all these years, it’s difficult for me to see him like this. He is void of any motivation and it’s only going to get worse. I want to take him on an interrailling trip across Europe for 1 month in Summer. He has always wanted to go, and I know this will significantly help him. Unfortunately being a student means being relatively challenged in the financial department, and I don’t have the money to send him myself. He has no idea about this; it’s going to be a surprise if it goes ahead. We both need to get our lives back on track, all he needs is the proper inspiration. 

Thank you to anyone who can support this. It will mean so much to me.
story_txt:
Hi, my name is Connie and I want to raise money to send my boyfriend and I on a trip around Europe. Student life can be hard, as my boyfriend and I have only very recently found out – studying, social life, making living affordable – you get the idea. Although many people will endure these difficult times, some will find themselves suffering a lot more than most. One of these people I believe is my boyfriend of 7 years. 
We came from very different backgrounds, him and me. He came from a poor background in a relatively rough part of our city, with no educational aspirations or encouragement from his family. He agreed that he was to be destined to sign on to the dole. After we started talking, getting to know each other and seeing how each other lived, I tried to help him understand that he could achieve more in life than he thought he could. He soon found he had talent in music, soon became enthusiastic about design, and by the end of school he left with far better grades than most. I was so proud of him, and still am to this day. 
At the age of 18, only months after leaving school, we started university – he is studying design and myself nursing. We had plans to take a gap year after year 2 of uni to travel across Europe, which we put a lot of time and effort into planning. Everything was going well, until he suddenly lost his both of his grandfathers, one to a stroke and the other to a heart attack, and his own father suffered from other sudden heart issues. Needless to say this left a significant impact on him, and it was very noticeable to me. He was always a bit of a hypochondriac, but with all these things happening around him, it began to feel much more real to him. 
He was diagnosed with severe anxiety and depression 2 years ago now, during which time he has become quiet, introverted and even afraid of going outside the house. I myself suffered from this in the past, and know how he feels.  After seeing him do so well all these years, it’s difficult for me to see him like this. He is void of any motivation and it’s only going to get worse.
I want to take him on an interrailling trip across Europe for 1 month in Summer. He has always wanted to go, and I know this will significantly help him. Unfortunately being a student means being relatively challenged in the financial department, and I don’t have the money to send him myself. He has no idea about this; it’s going to be a surprise if it goes ahead. We both need to get our lives back on track, all he needs is the proper inspiration. Thank you to anyone who can support this. It will mean so much to me.

story:
EV City Trike is a new direction for inner city transport. Ditch the car, ditch the van: find a better, more efficient and simpler way of travelling around the city.

EV City Trike is a range of vehicles for urban mobility that combine pedal power with electric to provide highly efficient transport for both personal travel and local deliveries.

Technically classed as e-bikes, EV City Trike's can be used wherever a bicycle can be used and can be ridden by anyone aged 14 or over. No drivers licence, no road tax, no expensive insurance, you can either pedal and use them like bicycles, or sit back and let the electric motor take the strain. EV City Trike's can be ridden on cycle paths and lanes, and are narrow enough to cut through the rush-hour traffic with ease.

The all-aluminium custom designed chassis weighs just 14.6kg (shown without roof support, front and side crash impact protection bars).
EV City Trike Cargo chassis with roof and windscreen support.

EV City Trike is safe. Its eye-catching design is more visible than a bicycle or motorbike, with a high-up seating position to give you a commanding view of the road. It's been designed by experienced automotive designers and incorporates safety features normally only ever found on cars, with integral crumple zones, automotive quality lighting, mirrors and seat belts fitted as standard.

EV City Trike 2Go is a two seat electric pedal trike with room for two people and luggage.
EV City Trike Cargo has an impressive 250kg payload in its 2.8 cubic metre cargo box.

EV City Trike is super efficient. It weighs just 60kg - just over 130 pounds - and can travel up to 50 miles on a single kilowatt-hour of electricity.

The hand-held batteries can be taken off for recharging, or charged up using an optional roof-top solar panel whilst the vehicle is in use.

Battery Swapping is easy with our lightweight handheld battery pack.

We are well on the way to completing our first vehicle - EV City Trike Cargo - a ¼ tonne van, which is being road tested prior to launch this Spring. Now we want to expand the range, with a two-seat passenger vehicle (EV City Trike 2Go) and a three-seater EV City Trike Taxi.

The EV City Trike range

We're planning three vehicles in the EV City Trike range:

EV City Trike Cargo

EV City Trike Cargo is our ultra-lightweight delivery vehicle. We have already done most of the development work on this vehicle and are planning to put it into production this Spring.

An enclosed cockpit provides a safe driving environment with protection from the elements. The unique cargo pod design can carry an astonishing 88 cubic feet of freight weighing up to one quarter of a tonne. The cargo pod can also be removed and swapped within seconds, giving us the flexibility of creating lots of different versions of this flexible design: a pickup truck, a flat bed, an advertising vehicle, even a mobile shop or coffee vendor can easily be built and fitted to our trike.

An optional solar roof provides enough energy to keep the on-board batteries topped up during the day: even on a dull winters day, the solar panel can generate enough power to give a range of up to 15 miles, whilst during the summer, the solar panel can provide a range of up to 60 miles.

Flat battery? Slide out the handheld battery pack and slot in a charged one. No need to park up to charge, EV City Trike Cargo can keep going, twenty-four hours a day. An optional roof-top solar panel can charge the batteries as you drive, which means for many owners they may not have to charge their batteries at all.

EV City Trike Cargo has been designed for city centre work: cut through the traffic using cycle lanes, squeeze into the tightest parking space and hop from delivery to delivery quickly and efficiently. With running costs of just a few pence a day, operators can save hundreds of pounds each month compared with running and fuelling a conventional small van.

EV City Trike Cargo production commences this March. We already have customers for them. If you live in Central London, you'll see them delivering packages and mail in just a few weeks time.

EV City Trike 2Go

EV City Trike 2Go is a stylish and fun way to travel.

EV City Trike 2Go is our passenger vehicle, currently under development for launch this summer. Taking two people and their luggage, EV City Trike is an eye-catching and stylish vehicle that allows you to cut through the rush hour traffic using cycle paths and lanes, yet gives you protection from the elements.

As with all our EV City Trikes, EV City Trike 2Go can be driven by anyone aged 14 or over. No driving licence, no tax, it can be used wherever you can use an ordinary bicycle.

Like EV City Trike Cargo, EV City Trike 2Go doesn't need to be parked up in order to charge the batteries. Unlock the handheld battery pack and it slides out in seconds. Slot in a fully charged battery to keep going and charge up your flat battery pack inside your home or place of work.

A generous luggage area takes the weekly shop with ease, whilst optional doors makes EV City Trike 2Go a practical vehicle for year-round use.

EV City Trike Taxi

EV City Trike Taxi is our ultra-modern take on the humble cycle rickshaw. Tourists love the cycle rickshaw experience and the EV City Trike Taxi brings this right up to date with a high tech, ultra-modern design. Unlike many cycle rickshaws, EV City Trike Taxi includes weather protection, luggage space, and safety built in.

EV City Trike Taxi provides seating for driver, two passengers and their luggage. It also incorporates safety features such as seat-belts and front and rear crumple zones to protect driver and passengers in the event of a shunt.

An optional solar roof provides an extended range and powers the on-board entertainment system. Optional twin video displays can entertain passengers and provide interactive advertising for passers-by.

The EV City Trike potential

We believe the worldwide market for the EV City Trike range is huge. Initially we're concentrating on Europe and North America, but later on we're planning on creating specific versions for South America and Asia, replacing existing diesel and two-stroke petro-oil engines with lighter, more efficient and less polluting electric vehicles.

Around many of the world's poorer countries, three wheel delivery vans and auto-rickshaw taxi's have huge, widespread use. Typically powered by diesel or two-stroke petro-oil mix, they are noisy, smelly and bad for the environment. Over half a million are sold each year. The biggest complaint from operators of these vehicles is the cost of fuel: it is common for the drivers to pay more for fuel than they earn themselves.

We believe that volume production in countries like Mexico and India will allow us to build EV City Trikes at a price and a specification to match the purchase price of these other vehicles. Combined with roof-top solar charging and tiny running costs, we believe the EV City Trike range could replace hundreds of thousands of diesel and two-stroke powered vehicles, with quiet, non-polluting, environmentally friendly EV City Trikes, making a genuine difference to the environment.

EV City Trike Technical Specification

Construction

  • Aluminium chassis and frame
  • Vacuum formed plastic bodyshell

Weights

EV City Trike 2Go

  • 60kg unladen weight (132 pounds)
  • Total weight with two passengers and luggage - 227kg (500 pounds)

EV City Trike Cargo 

  • 60kg unladen weight (132 pounds) excluding cargo pod. 
  • Cargo pod weight varies depending on exact specification.
  • Up to 227kg payload (500 pounds) depending on cargo pod.
  • Maximum weight with rider and payload - 336kg (740 pounds)

EV City Trike Taxi

  • Maximum weight with rider, two passengers and luggage - 336kg (740 pounds)

Power and Drivetrain

  • 48 volt front-wheel hub motor with PWM drive controller
  • 250w continuous power output (Europe), 750w continuous power out (US), 500w continuous power output (Canada and Australia).
  • Regenerative braking energy recovery system.
  • Pedal power to rear wheels through limited slip differential.
  • 48v 10 amp-hour detachable battery pack. Hot swap in under 1 minute.
  • Optional roof-top solar panel: 300Wp panel on City Trike Cargo and City Trike Taxi, 60Wp panel on City Trike 2Go.
  • Solar only range of up to 50 miles per day on City Trike Cargo and City Trike Taxi, up to 10 miles per day on City Trike 2Go.

Braking

  • Front: Disc brake
  • Rear: Twin in-board disc brakes

Safety

  • LED lighting, front and rear
  • Front, rear and side facing reflectors
  • Indicators
  • Twin rear-view mirrors
  • Front impact protection crumple-zone
  • Riders seat belt
  • Passengers seat belts on City Trike 2Go and City Trike Taxi

Performance

  • Equivalent of 2,200 miles per imperial gallon - i.e. travel 2,200 miles for the energy equivalent of one gallon of petrol)
  • Up to 30 mile range per battery pack. Multiple battery packs can be carried and swapped in under one minute.
  • Maximum speed of between 15mph and 20mph for eBike versions, varying depending on local legislation (15mph for UK and mainland Europe). Top speed of 30mph for motorcycle variants planned for Asia and South America.

Appropriate Legislation

  • UK Legislation classifies this vehicle as an e-bike under the Electrically Assisted Pedal Cycle Regulations 1983 (SI 1983/1168).
  • The European version is classified as an Electrically Assisted Pedal Cycle (EAPC) under EU directive 2002/24/EC, and conforming to product safety standard EN 15194 (2009).
  • US version classified as a low speed electric cycle (16 CFR Part 1512).
  • Canadian version classified as a Power Assisted Bicycle (PAB). NOTE: Not legal in New Brunswick state.

Project Status

So far, we've been building our first pre-production vehicles. Chassis and drive-train development is complete and we have been running our vehicles - without bodies - for the past month, including road testing. First bodies for the EV City Trike Cargo have been completed and they are in the process of being fitted to our first vehicle (chassis number 2).

Fully completed pre-production versions of EV City Trike Cargo's will take to the streets by the end of January and real world evaluations with customers commence in mid February.

EV City Trike Taxi is a close derivative of EV City Trike Cargo: the chassis and cab is identical to EV City Trike Cargo. Only the rear of the vehicle is different, and in fact, customers could convert their bikes between cargo and taxi variants by changing the rear of the vehicle themselves.

EV City Trike 2Go is a narrower and shorter vehicle than EV City Trike Cargo. Mechanically, the vehicle is identical to the cargo and taxi derivatives and the chassis are built on the same jig as the bigger models. First prototypes of EV City Trike 2Go are scheduled to be built in April and May.

Who are we?

We are Bluebird Performance Engineering, a specialist electric vehicle design business based in the United Kingdom. Our design team have been developing electric vehicles since the 1990s, building everything from milk floats and leisure cars to the Electric Bluebird land speed race car which broke the UK electric car land speed records between 1998 and 2000.

The Bluebird BE-3 electric land speed car broke eight national land speed records and won a Millennium Design Award.

Our designers come from an automotive background. With a focus on form and efficiency, we take pride in creating vehicles that are super-efficient, practical and fun to use.

How EV City Trike's are made

EV City Trikes will be built by our own dedicated team of people based in the United Kingdom. Initially, our production team has the ability to manufacture up to 50 vehicles a month, but our plan is to set up a number of factories around the world to manufacture up to 3,000 vehicles per month at each location, using local staff and creating specific versions of EV Cargo Trike for different regions.

Three wheel taxi's and small vans make up a significant proportion of the traffic in India's cities.

Whilst these numbers may seem overly ambitious in Europe and North America, anyone who has ever been to India, China, Pakistan, The Philippines, Mexico, Argentina or Brazil will have seen how many three-wheel taxis, pick-up trucks and vans there are on the road. 

Why are we developing EV City Trikes?

We're genuinely excited about the potential for electric vehicles and for what they can mean for our future. We believe they can have a substantial impact on the environment, reducing carbon emissions and pollution in some of the worlds most crowded cities.

Yet to make a real difference means thinking in new ways. Simply replacing a conventional car with an electric car gives a limited benefit. Looking at how vehicles are used and creating a brand new type of vehicle from the ground up to answer the needs for the 21st Century gives the real opportunity for a positive change for the future.

Take the EV City Trike Cargo, for example. Because we can use cycle lanes and cut through busy traffic, our trike can deliver goods faster and more efficiently than using a conventional van. Our research suggests that up to 25% of all the vans delivering goods in and around the centre of London could be replaced by trikes, streamlining the delivery process, reducing the cost of deliveries for business and removing an estimated eighteen million tonnes of Carbon Dioxide and NOx emissions from the air in London every year.

Look across the world and the opportunities are far greater. There are an estimated three million three wheel Tuk-tuk three wheel taxis in use around the world and around half a million three wheel commercial vehicles are sold each year. The vast majority of these are used in third world cities where the smog hangs over the cities like a thick cloud and tens of thousands of people die as a result every year.

Imagine the difference to city pollution levels if low-cost solar powered vehicles replaced dirty diesel and two-stroke petrol engines? We can't achieve everything right now, but step by step, we can get to the point where our EV City Trike can genuinely replace these vehicles at a similar price point.

Why Indiegogo?

We've got this far using our own funds and our own dedication. We are serious about what we do and we have had considerable interest from investors from around the world.

Yet not all money is created equal. Finding partners who are passionate about the vision and not just in making a quick buck is not so easy.

Indiegogo is different. Finding a community that is so dynamic and so keen on change has been genuinely exciting and has motivated our entire team. So instead of talking to investors who are just interested on a return on their investment in the shortest possible time, we're looking for the Indiegogo community to join us on the exciting journey to create a new generation of low carbon vehicles.

We already have customers for our vehicles. The first EV City Trike Cargo's will be delivered to these customers this Spring.

With Indiegogo, we can go further: not just have one model, but put three variants of the EV City Trike into production. The money will be used for producing the first production models, employing staff and getting the vehicles into the hands of our customers.

Risks and Challenges

As Bluebird, we're used to technical challenges and overcoming them. From designing land speed record breaking racing cars to putting an electric milk float into production in China, our designers, engineers and managers have learnt how to overcome the challenges that designing and producing a new electric vehicle throws up.

Technically, EV City Trike is one of the simplest developments we've ever worked on. Yet it hasn't been without its challenges.

Our initial design brief was to "build an electric van for city centre deliveries that can carry a quarter of a tonne and weighs less than 60 kilograms". Could it be done? Conventional wisdom, automotive designers and existing pedal trike manufacturers said it couldn't. It took six months of designing, computer simulations, prototyping and planning to prove it could.

It has meant looking closely at every aspect of the design, fine-tuning components to ensure the best efficiency. For example, our limited slip differential and rear axle, complete with twin inboard disk brakes, weighs less than 4 kilos. The battery pack weighs about the same.

Compare that to a conventional light electric van where the final drive weighs 60kg and the battery pack weighs a further 150kg, you can see how designing in efficiency can have significant environmental and cost savings in the amount of raw materials used to manufacture a vehicle.

We've had suppliers let us down; we've had components that looked great on the computer but that needed rework when they were built and tested; we've gone back to the drawing board to make a good design even better where we see the need and we've been working with the authorities to ensure the vehicle passes all the safety and legislative tests before it can be put on sale. It's all part of the development, testing and production processes.

Once complete, however, will it sell? Initial reaction from around the world suggests it will. We have interest in manufacturing EV City Trike in Mexico and India, we have interest from distributors and retailers around the world. We already have customers in the United Kingdom who will take delivery of their first vehicles this Spring.

We are planning on appointing our first sales agents this Spring, and touring the UK to demonstrate and show EV City Trike to the public this summer. Next year, we'll have EV City Trike's in volume production in the UK and be working hard on getting them into production in other countries around the world.

No business is ever guaranteed its success, but we are confident that EV City Trike is a great product that is here to stay.

The vast majority of these are used in third world cities where the smog hangs over the cities like a thick cloud and tens of thousands of people die as a result every year.
Imagine the difference to city pollution levels if low-cost solar powered vehicles replaced dirty diesel and two-stroke petrol engines? We can't achieve everything right now, but step by step, we can get to the point where our EV City Trike can genuinely replace these vehicles at a similar price point.
Why Indiegogo?
We've got this far using our own funds and our own dedication. We are serious about what we do and we have had considerable interest from investors from around the world.
Yet not all money is created equal. Finding partners who are passionate about the vision and not just in making a quick buck is not so easy.
Indiegogo is different. Finding a community that is so dynamic and so keen on change has been genuinely exciting and has motivated our entire team. So instead of talking to investors who are just interested on a return on their investment in the shortest possible time, we're looking for the Indiegogo community to join us on the exciting journey to create a new generation of low carbon vehicles.
We already have customers for our vehicles. The first EV City Trike Cargo's will be delivered to these customers this Spring.
With Indiegogo, we can go further: not just have one model, but put three variants of the EV City Trike into production. The money will be used for producing the first production models, employing staff and getting the vehicles into the hands of our customers.
Risks and Challenges
As Bluebird, we're used to technical challenges and overcoming them. From designing land speed record breaking racing cars to putting an electric milk float into production in China, our designers, engineers and managers have learnt how to overcome the challenges that designing and producing a new electric vehicle throws up.
Technically, EV City Trike is one of the simplest developments we've ever worked on. Yet it hasn't been without its challenges.
Our initial design brief was to "build an electric van for city centre deliveries that can carry a quarter of a tonne and weighs less than 60 kilograms". Could it be done? Conventional wisdom, automotive designers and existing pedal trike manufacturers said it couldn't. It took six months of designing, computer simulations, prototyping and planning to prove it could.
It has meant looking closely at every aspect of the design, fine-tuning components to ensure the best efficiency. For example, our limited slip differential and rear axle, complete with twin inboard disk brakes, weighs less than 4 kilos. The battery pack weighs about the same.
Compare that to a conventional light electric van where the final drive weighs 60kg and the battery pack weighs a further 150kg, you can see how designing in efficiency can have significant environmental and cost savings in the amount of raw materials used to manufacture a vehicle.
We've had suppliers let us down; we've had components that looked great on the computer but that needed rework when they were built and tested; we've gone back to the drawing board to make a good design even better where we see the need and we've been working with the authorities to ensure the vehicle passes all the safety and legislative tests before it can be put on sale. It's all part of the development, testing and production processes.
Once complete, however, will it sell? Initial reaction from around the world suggests it will. We have interest in manufacturing EV City Trike in Mexico and India, we have interest from distributors and retailers around the world. We already have customers in the United Kingdom who will take delivery of their first vehicles this Spring.
We are planning on appointing our first sales agents this Spring, and touring the UK to demonstrate and show EV City Trike to the public this summer. Next year, we'll have EV City Trike's in volume production in the UK and be working hard on getting them into production in other countries around the world.
No business is ever guaranteed its success, but we are confident that EV City Trike is a great product that is here to stay.

story:
Fancy of travelling? Like ca$h? Both? We create an exciting app for You!

We are ZeroE Engineering. Our main profile is investing into strange/funny ideas or hobby projects.

On a sunny afternoon we found out: it would be great to see the voyages of $100 notes around the globe. Chose the $100, because it is well known all over the world. So started to implement the basics of this project.This campaign is important for us as this is our first Indiegogo project and through this funding method we can introduce the webpage to the public - as having users is a must for having an enjoyable service - for FREE. So funding this project You will be a part of a funny, interesting system!

For the funders it will be a fun to use it for first and see their notes are travelling over cities and countries. As a reward we can offer extra coloured bubbles signing Your $100's trip.

In case of full funding, we create a service with the following features:
  • users can see the movement in the past of their registered notes, no login needed
  • login/password implemented for tracking all the registered notes by You
  • ability contacting the current owner of the registered note /in case of enabled by both parts/
  • exciting statistics, eg.: the longest trip of a note; number of registered notes, most frequent note, the amount of registered by the most frequent user, distribution by continents, highest concentration etc.
  • nice design
Additional goals:
  • if funding reaches 40.000 USD, we develop the feature to have friends and see their cash trips too with different colour on the map
  • if funding reaches 60.000 USD, we show the mass flow directions on the main page on an additional map
  • if funding reaches 100.000 USD, we do an online poll for add another currency for the same or into a new service
If we don't reach the original funding goal, we will implement as described below:
  • reaching 10 000 USD, we implement the basic application and make it public for a year. 
  • reaching 20 000 USD, we implement the features proportionally and make it run for two years.
We show regular updates and key milestones here.


Even You can help us with advertising and using our planned service - we need a lot of users!

story:
As seen in

Over the last two years I have taken thousands of street portraits and collected some of the most heart warming, funny, gut-wrenching, sad, hopeful, insightful stories I've ever heard. Each neighborhood has its own distinct flavor and rhythm, so what better way to get an authentic look into San Francisco than from the people who make this city what it is? Here are a few great stories from the project:

Stories

From the TenderNob

"I love that hat! Mind if I take your picture?"

"I don’t mind." 

"Thank you so much, I appreciate you taking the time to stop." 

"I’m 91 years old, I’m not afraid to talk to anybody."

"You seem very healthy and with it, what’s your secret?" 

"I don’t eat shit. Meat, chicken, fish, none of it. I’m not an athlete or anything though. I’m actually a troublemaker, I’ve been arrested 6 times."

"What for?"

"Protesting. Last time was when Dick Cheney came to town, I was there protesting and they arrested me instead of him. Can you believe that?" 

"I can actually. What brought you to San Francisco?"

"I came here because I knew it was where I wanted to die."

"Do you want to die?"

"I’m ready for it. The older you get the more ready for it you are. I’ve been waiting 11 years."

"So you were ready at 80? You’ve never been afraid of death? That seems to be a lot of people’s greatest fear."

"The greatest fear is fear. Death is just a gateway to higher consciousness. The fear comes from religions. They try to indoctrinate you with all this crap to make you scared and coming back to them. I only made it past the 8th grade but I know how to think for myself. The secret is to question things."

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From Hayes Valley

"I like your style."

"I like yours."

"Can I sit down with you for a minute?"

"Sure."

"Are you a writer?"

"No, I’m an amateur physicist."

"Got any good stories?"

"So I’m at my physics study group at my bodega, and I’m tripping on molly, and this guy walks in, and he looks exactly like Maude, from Harold and Maude, and it’s just one of those silver bullet moments where you realize you’re instantly in love. Like instantly. And I just jumped on him, and I didn’t stop talking till like 6 in the morning. Then we parted ways. The next morning he sends me this video, it’s called Paperman. It won an Oscar for like, best short. And the plot of that is there’s this guy. And he runs into this girl on the subway, and she gets her lipstick on a piece of paper. Then he goes to work and they miss each other, when he gets there she’s in the building across from him and he makes hundreds of paper airplanes trying to get her attention. And it doesn’t work. But then all these paper airplanes, in this Disney cinematic way, whirl him up and take him to her. So my guy lives in this mansion on Alamo Square. So I spent like the whole week making these paper airplanes for him. Like thousands of them, like stealing paper reams from work and making paper airplanes. I ask my friends to help me, so me and thirty other people cover this mansion. Fucking cover it. He comes home and says, 'Nobody’s ever done this for me before. I’m totally in love with you.' So I win his heart…or so I think, because that’s the end of it and he never texts me again. Then when I get drunk enough to text him to ask ‘What gives?’ he texts back saying, ‘I’m sorry but my heart belongs to someone else.’ But then, 5 days pass and he texts me again saying he made a mistake and he wants to be with me. So I don’t know if that’s a good story yet. I don’t think the arc is complete. So you know, I put myself out there. And now I’m invited back in, but I’m too scared to go there again because it failed…but it kinda succeeded. I don’t know.”

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From The Mission

"Do you live in this neighborhood?"

"Yeah, I moved here from Nicaragua when I was 14 and have been here my whole life."

"Has the neighborhood changed much since you’ve been here?"

"Oh yeah, in 1972 the milkman would bring milk in glass bottles to your doorstep and leave them. And no one would touch them. Now…forget about it. People will kill you here on the street for $5. Sometimes they think you have something and they kill you, and then they realize you have nothing."

"Why do you think everything changed?"

"Drugs. It’s drugs. Too much drugs. But what are you gonna do? Time changes things. Some people say, ‘The world…the world has changed.’ The world hasn’t changed. People’s attitude has changed."

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From The Fillmore

"Hi! Would you mind if I take your picture?"

"Sure! My name’s Grace. I live in the senior center up on Fillmore. I’m a senior citizen. I’m 72 years old. I’ve lived here since 1972 and I stayed until 1976 when I moved to Richmond because I didn’t want to raise my kids in the projects, but that was before there were all the drugs and foolishness going on out there. Me…I just liked to work, go to church, and raise my kids but a lot of people out there were into that other stuff.”

"How many kids do you have?"

"6, I raised 5 of them. 1 was kidnapped when he was 6 months old. His father took him and told him a bunch of lies. He told him that he was found on a doorstep. He didn’t find out about me till he was 23 years old. Then he came out and met me at the train station. I remember he said he was going to be wearing a Bart Simpson t-shirt, but then it was too cold and everyone had jackets on. But I just went on up to the person I thought looked like my kin and asked, 'Are you wearing a Bart Simpson t-shirt?' and he gave me a big hug and said, 'You’re my mama!'

"That’s a great story."

"That’s San Francisco, when I was back in Lufkin, Texas, that’s where I’m from, I told people I wanted to go to San Francisco. All that was there for me in Texas was picking cotton, the KKK and people telling me I wasn’t shit. They told me if I tried to leave I’d end up dead on the street. But you know what I told them?" 

"What?"

"Dead is dead, but before I die I’m going to see San Francisco!"

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From a Transient Spirit

"Hey, we’re visiting from Pennsylvania. Can you tell me where there are Buddhist temples here?"

"Yeah, there’s one in Hayes Valley. Are you Buddhist?"

"I’m Sikh."

"What are the tenents of being a Sikh?"

"They’re the same as another religion. It’s about love, compassion, kindness. The ways we practice are different but the core is the same."

"What’s unique about your practice?"

"We don’t cut our hair, or alter our body in any way. In our view the body is sacred. It’s a gift from God. And God is not a man in the sky. It’s a level of consciousness. It’s an energy you take in when you eat food, a fragrance you take in when you smell a flower, an energy you breathe in and out when you are true harmony. I don’t know what happens when you achieve that level of harmony, but that’s the goal."

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Join the discussion on Facebook here

The Book

A 1st edition 60-page art book will be published in February 2014. The book will be published as a 

  • 10x8 hardcover  
  • 13x11 large format hardcover.

Volume 1 is a 40-page book that was released in March 2013. Volume 2 will begin being designed during this campaign. There will be approximately 100 photographs with written stories accompanying several of the pictures.

Back Cover of Volume 1:

Tote Bag

Hoodies

We've partnered with Original Language to bring you some dope Souls of San Francisco hoodies. Souls logo on the front, sacred geometry on the back. Below are a few of the  possible designs. For a full list of colors and designs click HERE 


BELOW ARE THE DESIGNS THAT WILL BE ON THE BACK OF THE HOODIES.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the project with your friends and spread the word on your social networking sites like Facebook and Twitter.

Social Media

You can also find us on Facebook | Twitter | Tumblr

story:
We all love the exhilarating feeling of just being in nature and exhausting ourselves on the trail. We should be rewarded and take a load off where ever we want, whenever we want. The Chameleon Pack/ Sit System lets you sit back and enjoy the beauty without having to choose between a rock and a hard place.

Beyond just a backpack to chair transformation, the Chameleon can separate to form 2 backpacks. Each Chameleon includes two 16 liter removable stuff sacks that hold all of your gear inside. They can be carried independently as separate drawstring slings or can connect together to form a 32-liter drawstring backpack so you get two for one.

 

 

With your 2 included removable Switch Bags, you won’t have to worry about emptying your pack before taking a load off.  The Standard Switch Bags are accessible from the top by drawstring when housed inside the pack, but also 2 full-length zippers that zip from top to bottom and bottom to top. This gives you easy access to your stuff from any angle, both as a backpack and when lounging in your chair.

 

OPTIONAL UPGRADE TO CUSTOM SWITCH BAGS

Using our patent-pending technology, you’ll be able to sit back, relax and unwind whenever wherever. The ultra-light, aluminum, collapsible Sit-System frame is rated up to 300 pounds. The anchors and seat flap are permanently fastened and secure. 

 

 

No matter where life takes you, the Chameleon will be there to carry your load or help you take a load off, keeping you comfortable and prepared at all times.

 

You need a pack that can withstand whatever you throw at it, which is why we made the Chameleon with heavy duty abrasion and water-resistant denier nylon. The interior Switch Bags provide an added layer of protection from the elements.  

 

 

Each Chameleon has 36 liters worth of storage to hold everything from your weekend camping or hiking gear to your school, work, or leisure supplies. We made sure to include water bladder and laptop storage spaces, along with a side cup holder. To take it a step further, we designed the pack with Molle, used in military and tactical bags, that allow you to attach your desired items and increase the capacity to suit your needs. The lashing buckles make it easy to carry larger items like fishing poles, tents, compound hunting bows or anything you can think of.  

 

 

 

The Chameleon isn’t just for hikers, campers, hunters and fishermen. We designed the Chameleon to be useful for all active people, like athletes, parents, students, park goers, tail-gaiters, backyard barbecuers and everyone in between. The best part is that you won’t have to choose function over fashion with the Chameleon’s jaw-dropping, one-of-a-kind design. So go show it off wherever you go!  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Hey, you made it down this far, why stop now?! While you might not be able to support us with a pledge, you can always help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!  

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make the Chameleon a success.
story_txt:
When your gear does more, you can carry less. We designed the Chameleon Backpack to make it easier to get outdoors and make your experience more comfortable and enjoyable anytime, anywhere!  We all love the exhilarating feeling of just being in nature and exhausting ourselves on the trail. We should be rewarded and take a load off where ever we want, whenever we want. The Chameleon Pack/ Sit System lets you sit back and enjoy the beauty without having to choose between a rock and a hard place.
 


Using the Chameleon’s patent-pending Penta-zip technology, simply unzip, arrange the collapsible Sit-System frame, attach the pack to the frame, then sit back and relax.The removable Switch Bags™ that hold all of your gear will drape over the sides of the chair so you can easily access everything you need without emptying your pack. 
Beyond just a backpack to chair transformation, the Chameleon can separate to form 2 backpacks. Each Chameleon includes two 16 liter removable stuff sacks that hold all of your gear inside. They can be carried independently as separate drawstring slings or can connect together to form a 32-liter drawstring backpack so you get two for one.
 
 


 

Here's how the Chameleon Pack is "FORGING NEW TRAILS" in the outdoor backpack industry. THEY ARE ALREADY TALKING ABOUT IT...

 

With your 2 included removable Switch Bags, you won’t have to worry about emptying your pack before taking a load off.  The Standard Switch Bags are accessible from the top by drawstring when housed inside the pack, but also 2 full-length zippers that zip from top to bottom and bottom to top. This gives you easy access to your stuff from any angle, both as a backpack and when lounging in your chair.

 
OPTIONAL UPGRADE TO CUSTOM SWITCH BAGS

Choose between the following CUSTOM combinations:
1. Dry Switch Bag with a Cooler Bag  2. Dry Switch Bag with a Compartment/Camera Bag 
3. Compartment/ Camera Bag with a Cooler Bag  4. Two Dry Switch Bags
*Notice by purchasing BOTH options 1 AND 2 OR 3 AND 4 you will be able to achieve all four configurations. Available MAY 2018
The best part about ALL of the Switch Bags? They can be used as individual slings or combined together to form a backpack. Think of it as two packs in one.





Using our patent-pending technology, you’ll be able to sit back, relax and unwind whenever wherever. The ultra-light, aluminum, collapsible Sit-System frame is rated up to 300 pounds. The anchors and seat flap are permanently fastened and secure. 

 

 

No matter where life takes you, the Chameleon will be there to carry your load or help you take a load off, keeping you comfortable and prepared at all times.

 

You need a pack that can withstand whatever you throw at it, which is why we made the Chameleon with heavy duty abrasion and water-resistant denier nylon. The interior Switch Bags provide an added layer of protection from the elements.  

 

 


Each Chameleon has 36 liters worth of storage to hold everything from your weekend camping or hiking gear to your school, work, or leisure supplies. We made sure to include water bladder and laptop storage spaces, along with a side cup holder. To take it a step further, we designed the pack with Molle, used in military and tactical bags, that allow you to attach your desired items and increase the capacity to suit your needs. The lashing buckles make it easy to carry larger items like fishing poles, tents, compound hunting bows or anything you can think of.  

 

 

 

The Chameleon isn’t just for hikers, campers, hunters and fishermen. We designed the Chameleon to be useful for all active people, like athletes, parents, students, park goers, tail-gaiters, backyard barbecuers and everyone in between. The best part is that you won’t have to choose function over fashion with the Chameleon’s jaw-dropping, one-of-a-kind design. So go show it off wherever you go!  



 


 


 
 
 
 

 

 
 
 

Hey, you made it down this far, why stop now?! While you might not be able to support us with a pledge, you can always help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!  
We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make the Chameleon a success.

story:
ESEA STRAP®  has now been successfully funded via Indiegogo and is now available to buy direct online from our website.

ESEA STRAP® is available to buy in 4 sizes to suit hardboard and inflatable paddle boards between the sizes of 9 ft and 12ft 6". ESEA STRAP® can also be used on thinner race profile paddle boards up to 14ft in length.

 

ESEA STRAP® is designed for recreational and race use only, on flat water, rivers, lakes, estuaries and small surf – Similar to a coiled leash would be.

 

ESEA STRAP® is not intended for use in moderate to high surf or adverse

white water conditions.

 

Leashes save lives – but only if used appropriately and the correct type used for the respective conditions. If in any doubt or if you have any questions on any of the above please, get in touch and we’d be happy to help / advise.

 

 

 

 

ESEA STRAP®  cleverly utilizes existing technologies and has reinvented the humble ankle leash into a priceless carrying device.

Discretely stored within a small webbed pouch around your ankle is your carry strap.

 

 

 

 

                                           
 

 

Invented back in '71 by Pat O’Neill, the surfboard leash has been saving people from arduous swims back to shore ever since. 

Leashes are one of the most basic pieces of surf/paddle board equipment. They’re so common that we sometimes forget their main function is safety. 

ESEA STRAP® is no different, we have followed suit and adhered to all common safety specifications you would expect to find on a regular ankle leash.

 

To make sure you order the correct size ESEA STRAP® simply measure your board from top to tail as shown below.

 

 

 

It's really no wonder that paddle boarding has become one of the fastest growing water sports in the world, it's a fantastic, low impact sport that allows people of all ages to enjoy the water.

There is a rich diversity to the sport unlike no other, from SUP surfing to SUP long distance coastal races and even SUP Yoga, paddle boarding really does open up a world of possibilities.

 

The only down side to paddle boarding is the size of the boards.

In order for the boards to be stable and buoyant they must be long and wide, which is fine when you are on the water but poses problems when you have to carry them for any length of time.

 

There are various carrying aids currently on the market, such as bags, carry straps and trolleys all of which are cumbersome themselves and not cheap!

 

We set out to develop a brand new product that was small, smart and affordable .. and we did!

 

 

Thank you for taking the time to check out our product. If you like what you see and want to share with your friends, simply click the Share button at the top right corner of our page.

You can also follow us on Facebook & Instagram.      #FREEYOURADVENTURE

http://www.eseastrap.com

http://www.facebook.com/eseastrap

http://www.instagram.com/eseastrap

story:
Travel is stressful, but we're here to say it doesn't have to be. 

We're often in a constant state of anxiety. Looking over our shoulders to make sure our belongings are safe; the constant paranoia of becoming a victim of pickpockets. Or worse still, getting backaches on holidays from wearing frontpacks. Sound familiar?

We thought there had to be a better way. We searched high and low for the perfect daypack, but couldn't find one. So we designed one ourselves.

After 5 months, 4 prototypes, 2 trips, countless emails and cups of coffee later; we bring you The Freedom Pack.

 

We designed The Freedom Pack to be used as a packable daypack you transition into upon arrival at your destination.

We've put a lot of thought into our ethos of making travel gear work with you, not against you. Every feature and detail in the backpack has been carefully considered with the goal of helping you focus on enjoying and exploring with the peace of mind.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Most of all we wanted a backpack to give us the peace of mind. The Freedom Pack lets us focus on the important stuff - what's in front of us.

 

 

 

While developing the idea, we also wanted a backpack that was versatile in it's looks. Suitable for exploring both cities and the outdoors, The Freedom Pack is perfect for any adventure.

     

At Travelab we believe that travel broadens our horizons.

Our vision is to produce a suite of products that will make travel stress free and truly enjoyable.

We're starting with The Freedom Pack. We hope you’ll join us on our journey by backing The Freedom Pack today.

Looking over our shoulders to make sure our belongings are safe; the constant paranoia of becoming a victim of pickpockets. Or worse still, getting backaches on holidays from wearing frontpacks. Sound familiar?We thought there had to be a better way. We searched high and low for the perfect daypack, but couldn't find one. So we designed one ourselves.After 5 months, 4 prototypes, 2 trips, countless emails and cups of coffee later; we bring you The Freedom Pack.The World's First Packable Anti-Theft Backpack. The Freedom Pack collapses into it's own pouch so you'll never lose it. We designed The Freedom Pack to be used as a packable daypack you transition into upon arrival at your destination.Taking up minimal footprint in your main luggage, it expands to a perfectly sized 12 litres to carry your daily travel essentials. No more lugging your entire luggage around.We've put a lot of thought into our ethos of making travel gear work with you, not against you. Every feature and detail in the backpack has been carefully considered with the goal of helping you focus on enjoying and exploring with the peace of mind.The Freedom Pack is theft-proof. Hidden zippers combined with durable rip-resistant exteriors keep your belongings safe from pickpockets All of the bag's YKK zippered compartments are hidden against your back. Contrasting bright interiors make retrieving your belongings a breeze Quickly access your travel essentials, without having to take off the backpack Only premium materials and construction: 210T nylon anti-hydraulic pressure fabric It's weatherproof, because we know you'll still travel under all conditions A buckle clip lets you attach The Freedom Pack to almost anything, so you can do more And packs into it's built-in pouch so you don't have to worry about losing yet another thing.Most of all we wanted a backpack to give us the peace of mind. The Freedom Pack lets us focus on the important stuff - what's in front of us.   Size comparison with iPhone 6 Plus. The Freedom Pack weighs just 220 gramsWhile developing the idea, we also wanted a backpack that was versatile in it's looks. Suitable for exploring both cities and the outdoors, The Freedom Pack is perfect for any adventure.     At Travelab we believe that travel broadens our horizons.Our vision is to produce a suite of products that will make travel stress free and truly enjoyable.We're starting with The Freedom Pack. We hope you’ll join us on our journey by backing The Freedom Pack today.

story:
RAISING FUNDS FOR ROBBI SAPINGGI'S FAMILY:

It is with great sadness we share that one of our beloved colleagues and dedicated mountain guides, Robbi Sapinggi has passed away following the Magnitude 6.1 earthquake that hit Ranau yesterday. Robbi was a man of passion, he loved his job and the people he worked with. He was always joyful and his spirit was contagious.

The entire Amazing Borneo team will be attending Robbi's funeral tomorrow at 2pm in Kiau Village, Ranau--Robbi's hometown. Robbi left behind his wife and a 6 months old baby boy.

We have received inquiries asking how they can donate to Robbi. We have tried to get the bank account details of Robbi's direct family members but was not available due to the overwhelming situation they are experiencing. Hence we have now created this crowd funding for Robbi Sapinggi, who is indeed the unsung hero in this tragedy. 

P.S. All funds received will be recorded and donated in full to Robbi family members. 

From:
The Amazing Borneo Team

___________________________________________________________________________

Mount Kinabalu Updates:

We are deeply saddened to inform that we have lost one of our mountain guides Robbi Sapinggi due to the unfortunate mishap this morning 5 June 2015 at Mount Kinabalu. Robbi was accompanying our climber when he got hit by falling rocks.

Despite being injured, Robbi’s only thought was for the welfare of his guest, urging his guest to continue ahead to climb down the mountain to safety. He bravely chose to remain alone and wait for help rather than to put the guest’s life at further risk. Unfortunately, Robbi was unable to make it down the mountain in time to receive proper medical attention and he died due to loss of blood.

Robbi has been a dedicated member of the Mount Kinabalu team for the past two years, and always brought good experiences to our climbers. We received countless reviews about his excellent service throughout his time with us, and we are proud to say that he heroically took care of his guests all the way to the end. His passing is a great loss, not only to his family but also to Sabah Parks and our organization. He will always be our unsung Hero.

Our heartfelt condolences to his family.

____________________________________________________________________________

Jonna Baquilas of the Philippines who encountered him during a climb for Coalition Duchenne back in 2012 said:

“When I was climbing Mt. Kinabalu in 2012, alone in a sea of people, I gave up just a quarter of the way towards the summit. I don't know if it was out of fear, exhaustion or sheer lack of determination, but I just couldn't push myself any longer. I was crying, and I never felt so alone. I was with a hundred strangers.
Robbi was one of the guides of our group. When he learned about my doubts in proceeding to the summit, he didn't encourage me to go on. He said there will always be a next time, and if I was not emotionally ready, we should just head back to Laban Rata. He also didn't proceed to the summit, and stayed with me instead. I felt ashamed of myself for being a failure, but he assured me that there's no shame in prioritizing health and safety.
I was shivering from the cold, and my gloves were wet from grabbing onto the rope. My fingers were almost frozen. Without hesitation, he removed his gloves and gave them to me. He kept me warm in a hut while waiting for sunrise, and calmed my nerves with his antics.
On our way down, he got my camera and took really good photos of me. We talked about Manila, Filipinos, and the Filipino TV drama series "Pangako sa Yo." Apparently it was shown in Malaysia, and he was a big fan! I told him I will come back to Mt. Kinabalu to reach the summit, and I will get him as my personal guide next time.
It is sad to learn that one great soul was claimed by the mountain during the earthquake yesterday. Robbi was a good man, and his passion to keep climbers safe and happy is unquestionable.
Robbi, you were a great man. Please know that you've touched so many lives. I'm sure that when I decide to climb Mt. Kinabalu again, I will hear your laughter resonating through the mountains.”

story:
About

Populife is the safe, convenient, durable and affordable way to keep your items locked up! Populife securely stores and backs up your keys and access cards, allowing you to remotely control access to your home, office, car or vacation property directly from your smartphone. Populife is changing all of these!  

 

Populife is the smartest and most affordable lock box on the market.  Stop messing around with old lock box technology!  Get Populife and see how easy life can be with a smart technology lock box! 

USE IT AT HOME – Now your family and friends can always have a backup key if needed. No more worrying about lost keys! 

USE IT FOR YOUR BUSINESS – AirBNB owners, warehouse leasing, car renters and real estate agents can manage access remotely no matter how close or far you are from the property.

US IT ON YOUR PROPERTY – Keep swimming pool gate locked when you’re away, or keep your boat locked up with Populife!

USE IT IF YOU FORGET – Now if you go to the gym or grocery store and forget your key, you can open everything from your phone.

 

https://media.giphy.com/media/U3t6qAYNeHCS1kk1W... Even without the Populife app, you can still grant access with a PIN code that you create or with Bluetooth keys. For Bluetooth simply use your smartphone within range. It’s that easy!

It doesn’t matter where you are, you can always open Populife keybox. Grant access to your house even when you're away. With the Populife mobile app, it allows you to create a unique PIN code or Bluetooth key for your guests. It's the best fuss-free property management tool you’ll ever find!  No more meeting up for a key or late night drives to your property to grant access.  

If you want to set up a temporary password, Populife app lets you do it. Sometimes you want to grant access for a certain period of time. With Populife app, you can create a temporary PIN or Bluetooth key for visitors to use. Have the code last for hours, days, weeks, or even grant them permanent access.

All the interior space you’ll need.  The Populife keybox interior is spacious enough to hold up to six physical keys or seven keycards. This means that you can store the essentials for your guest in one place. 

The latest technology gives you peace of mind. We use encryption dictionary technology and offline cryptography algorithms (patent pending), which can have 150 passwords at the same time!  In addition, there are five security features designed to keep your keys and items safe:

Access logs are provided and allow you to track when visitors come and go. Now you know who’s accessing your property and when they are leaving.  Greater visibility allows for greater peace of mind.  

The Populife key box is built to withstand the elements. It's been tested to withstand dust and light rain (IP65 certified).  

Populife key box is weather resistant between -13℉—149℉（-25℃- 65℃），It doesn’t matter if it’s raining, snowing, or blazing hot outside.  Populife key box will always perform as needed and allow you instant access to your keys.   

Populife key box uses BLE Technology to make it consume less power and last longer. 4 AAA Alkaline batteries give you up to 10,000 Lock open and close operations (approx. 12 months).  Use it for months at a time without changing batteries every other week. 

Populife key box will also give you a battery alert when it reaches 20% power.  That way you always know when to replace the batteries and don’t get stuck with a dead lock box. 

If for some reasons the batteries do die on you, Populife key box lets you connect an external 9 Volt battery to provide emergency power.

Have you ever tried to open a lock box at night with no light. No more trying to fumble around with the flashlight on your phone while you try to punch in the code.  Populife key box has LED backlights that let you easily see what you’re doing and type in your PIN. 

Modern design means Populife key box fits most door handles. With 2 shackle sizes, it will fit most doorknobs. You can easily attach it to doors, fences or other locations.  

Populife is the world's first lock box which support ECHO Alexa voice assistant to manage access rights through the Populife app. In order to achieve this function. Gateway is required to be used  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Populife brand was inspired by the word Popular and Life, which the founder Walter Wang Yue and creative director Christie Zhong envision to provide trend life to digital nomads globally. 

The founder plan to invested over 1 Million USD to lead the sales executives from US, the former Foxconn chief, and the core members of Populife technology to jointly develop the innovative product to smart lock industry. Currently, the company has lined up a series of smart locks which are compatible with Southeast Asia's intelligent anti-theft door lock, smart indoor lock, and US deadbolt smart home lock. In 2020, the estimated sales of Populife are over 5 Million USD.

 

Risks and challenges

Populife has launched, completed and fulfilled multiple products on the market. While we generally know what we are doing, we have also learned to expect the unexpected. Unforeseen detours can result in delays that make our delivery estimates inaccurate. Ironically, time travel could resolve this issue, but that sort of temporal tampering has been known to cause chaos if not undertaken carefully. So, although we may unintentionally keep you waiting for your rewards longer than expected, in the end, we will deliver items that live up to your highest expectations (and beyond).

story:
Hey, it’s us again. The Crua Outdoors crew. We’re still out here doing what we can to make nature more accessible to everyone. 

The thing is, we love being outside, surrounded by the raw beauty of nature in all her majestic glory. But we don’t love being uncomfortable. 

So we’re making the great outdoors chill again. 

 

Tross is a data-driven crowdfunding agency

story:
Sometimes Bad Things Do Happen to Good People

We all want to believe that living a good life and doing well unto others somehow insulates us from bad things happening but sometimes Mother Nature with her wicked sense of humor just catches up with us.

Last week (Friday, August 3) fire swept through Norman, Oklahoma and took away everything from our sister-in-law, Jaime O'Brien.

Jamie is a single mom who has been struggling to raise her son Christian in Norman, Oklahoma. She has suffered from numerous medical issues over the last few years but has always managed to hold it together, hold down a job and make enough money to support her and Christian.

She's survived through some tough times, but through it all she maintains a great positive attitude, stays cheerful and always serves as a great role model for Christian.

But last week she lost everything she owns to a grass fire, and now she’s about to lose her job.

When the fire swept through her neighborhood she was able to grab a few clothes and possessions and get herself, Christian, his girlfriend and her little daughter to safety, but she lost her whole life in the process.

She lost her home, most of her life's possessions, family photographs, her grandma’s china, 3 of her cats, and, of all things, her false teeth! A few years ago, Jaime had to have all of her teeth removed due to a medical issue and now they are gone for good. So much that is irreplaceable, and yet she has managed to maintain her sense of humor through this whole thing. I’m not sure most of us could have stayed so calm.

To add insult to injury, at the end of this month she will also lose her job as the company she works for is shutting down in Oklahoma.

Not only will she be homeless but also unemployed.

The family is helping her out in the short term with a place to stay, food and clothing, but she is going to need much more assistance to re-build her life and find work.

As the governor has not declared this a federal emergency, she won't qualify for any federal or state assistance (although the Red Cross is doing what they can) and she doesn't have any insurance (insurance is very expensive on a mobile home in a rural area, with a volunteer fire dept and no fire hydrants. Jaime and most people living around her just couldn't afford it).

We're Raising Money to Rebuild Her Life

Our goal is at least $50,000 to rebuild her mobile home, furnish it and try to replace some of the basic things she lost.

We want to replace:

  • Her home
  • Her furniture
  • Her clothes, Christian’s, Angie’s and Charlotte’s (they lost nearly all of them, and all their shoes)
  • Definitely her teeth!

How You Can Help

To help Jaime rebuild her life and start over, please click the big pink button at the top or bottom of this page that says "Contribute Now."

When you do, you'll be able to enter the amount you'd like to contribute. You can donate easily with a credit card or PayPal.

To see how close we are to meeting our goal of raising $50k, look at the box at the top right of this page.

We appreciate any donation no matter how small.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel you can make a contribution at this time, we understand. Times are hard for many folks right now.

You can also help us enormously by just spreading the word about this campaign. Use the buttons below the picture at the top to post it to Facebook, Twitter and Google Plus and email it to friends and family on your list who might be able to help. Make some noise about this! That way it might reach anyone who just might be able to contribute.

Thank you in advance for supporting Jaime and her son Christian during this challenging time.

Press

You can read more about Jaime and the fires here:

http://normantranscript.com/headlines/x2068762033/Woman-grabs-pictures-forgets-teeth-in-the-fire

http://newsok.com/update-evacuations-under-way-in-cleveland-county-wildfire/article/3697827
story_txt:
Sometimes Bad Things Do Happen to Good People
We all want to believe that living a good life and doing well unto others somehow insulates us from bad things happening but sometimes Mother Nature with her wicked sense of humor just catches up with us.
Last week (Friday, August 3) fire swept through Norman, Oklahoma and took away everything from our sister-in-law, Jaime O'Brien.
Jamie is a single mom who has been struggling to raise her son Christian in Norman, Oklahoma. She has suffered from numerous medical issues over the last few years but has always managed to hold it together, hold down a job and make enough money to support her and Christian.
She's survived through some tough times, but through it all she maintains a great positive attitude, stays cheerful and always serves as a great role model for Christian.
But last week she lost everything she owns to a grass fire, and now she’s about to lose her job.
When the fire swept through her neighborhood she was able to grab a few clothes and possessions and get herself, Christian, his girlfriend and her little daughter to safety, but she lost her whole life in the process.
She lost her home, most of her life's possessions, family photographs, her grandma’s china, 3 of her cats, and, of all things, her false teeth! A few years ago, Jaime had to have all of her teeth removed due to a medical issue and now they are gone for good. So much that is irreplaceable, and yet she has managed to maintain her sense of humor through this whole thing. I’m not sure most of us could have stayed so calm.
To add insult to injury, at the end of this month she will also lose her job as the company she works for is shutting down in Oklahoma.
Not only will she be homeless but also unemployed.
The family is helping her out in the short term with a place to stay, food and clothing, but she is going to need much more assistance to re-build her life and find work.
As the governor has not declared this a federal emergency, she won't qualify for any federal or state assistance (although the Red Cross is doing what they can) and she doesn't have any insurance (insurance is very expensive on a mobile home in a rural area, with a volunteer fire dept and no fire hydrants. Jaime and most people living around her just couldn't afford it).
We're Raising Money to Rebuild Her Life
Our goal is at least $50,000 to rebuild her mobile home, furnish it and try to replace some of the basic things she lost.
We want to replace:

Her home
Her furniture
Her clothes, Christian’s, Angie’s and Charlotte’s (they lost nearly all of them, and all their shoes)
Definitely her teeth!
How You Can Help
To help Jaime rebuild her life and start over, please click the big pink button at the top or bottom of this page that says "Contribute Now."
When you do, you'll be able to enter the amount you'd like to contribute. You can donate easily with a credit card or PayPal.
To see how close we are to meeting our goal of raising $50k, look at the box at the top right of this page.
We appreciate any donation no matter how small.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't feel you can make a contribution at this time, we understand. Times are hard for many folks right now.
You can also help us enormously by just spreading the word about this campaign. Use the buttons below the picture at the top to post it to Facebook, Twitter and Google Plus and email it to friends and family on your list who might be able to help. Make some noise about this! That way it might reach anyone who just might be able to contribute.
Thank you in advance for supporting Jaime and her son Christian during this challenging time.
Press
You can read more about Jaime and the fires here:
http://normantranscript.com/headlines/x2068762033/Woman-grabs-pictures-forgets-teeth-in-the-fire
http://newsok.com/update-evacuations-under-way-in-cleveland-county-wildfire/article/3697827

story:
It'd be cool if you can share the above comment about Alpha...
we have put so much time and effort into designing this and would be awesome to hear what your thoughts are..



Move 250-1000KG at a touch of a button! It is fast, safe and can perform almost anywhere at anytime!


In a world where constant heavy moving is required Alpha can reduce and eliminate the excessive strain in all areas of the workplace. It will allow more productivity at a much shorter time than manual labor. Alpha will reduce your overhead costs by operating 24/7 across all weather conditions.


FEATURES:



FUNCTIONS;


Remote Control

With a 2.4Ghz Radio remote control and optional 5.8Ghz or Tablet ALPHA can be control from a mere few hundred meters away and It is simple to use.


Magnetic Strip

Simply lay down the provided magnetic strip from point A to point B. ALPHA will then travel along that route, from start and stop at the beginning and end of the strip. Maximum length of the strip provided will be 50 meters.


Autonomous

This is the most important and unique function for the design of ALPHA. Using this mode you can eliminate huge amount of man power to just one or two people at the same time reduce those OH&S Back problems. 
In Autonomous mode (fully automatic) no remote control or Magnetic strip is needed. You simply walk from where you want ALPHA to start from to where you want ALPHA to finish. 
For example a Film crew conducting shootings at the beach may require a large crew to carry and prepare the equipment. 
With ALPHA time and preparation can be cut down to more than 50%! This will save cost and increase safety for the lifting of heavy gears over long distance sandy beaches.


APPLICATIONS;


Hospitalities; Towels, Linens, medications can be load onto ALPHA customized platform and send off to its requested rooms and designation.


Filming; Can be use as a Dolley for shooting, carrying and transport equipment from trucks to the designated shooting area. No matter what, how rugged or far the terrain is, filming at places such as the beach, Park and other off-road places will cut down preparation time by more than 50%!


Warehousing; Using the scissor lift platform Alpha can help you to locate the item quickly just like how they do with stairs on library book shelves. Can be use to tall ceilings, fruit pickings etc..


Logistics; With just one person on either side for loading/unloading depending on load, Alpha can be remotely control or autonomously programmed to deliver cargo quickly and safely. 


Supermarkets; Integrating with your inventory Alpha will know which isle to go for staff to re-stock.


Departmental Stores; Re-stocking and removing/change of stocks make quick, safe and efficient by letting Alpha does the heavy job for you. From the Back room to the floor and whilst leaving staff to attend the floor Alpha can travel back and forth to load and unload merchandise for you.


Constructions; Pushing the wheel barrow with bricks, metals and other heavy objects becomings a thing of the past. With a touch of a button Alpha will go to you for loading and unloading regardless of the distant.


Security, Events and so much more....


QUICK INTERCHANGEABLE ADAPTABLE PLATFORMS/CARRYING TRAYS; (OPTIONAL)

Looking to move Houses, Logistics, Warehousing or Lease/Rental?

  1. Alpha can fit through your average door
  2. It can also be expand using our platform extension
  3. With a provided ram Alpha can climb in excessive of 45 degrees
  4. Load many boxes and even furnitures when moving houses or even storage facilities.


Hydraulics or Scissor lift;

Where ever height and staff shortage is a problem Alpha will be there. All it takes is one person to load and unload. The rest can either be control by a remote control or pre-programmed destination.


Disability? Up to 2 Passengers;

Finish your job and need to get around? Within minutes attach one of our chair platform and off you go. Alpha can fit a maximum of 2 passengers making perfect for the disable and their carer.




Solar Powered for Extra Juice working in the Outdoor;

Alpha can work perfectly outdoor and be continuously charge under the sun.


Other Trays/Carrying platforms can be customize according to your request. Please visit our website....


Stretch Goals; 

Allow Alpha to enhance its capability much further into a future of technological advance working robot.


Your Impact;

We designed ALPHA with safety for the workplace as the main purpose. 
We have had many people from many industries complained about the heavy lifting, carrying and pushing heavy objects over inclines and long distances, hence ALPHA was borne
It is fast, efficient, easy to maintain and able to carry large mass, weight or volume at any given time.
With your help we can prevent many heaving lifting injuries and possible hundreds of lives suffered in the cause of performing labor works.
 



About Us:

All of us really excited about this ALPHA as we believe it will revolutionize and bring forth a new era in Robot technology. 
Coming from different skills background and with your contribution we can all make ALPHA possible. 




FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Shipping:
- If you are not in Australia please contact us directly with your shipping address and the perks you would to contribute and we will provide you with the cost to manually add to the perks.
- If you forget to pay for shipping click the "Contribute Now" button at the top of the page, enter the shipping amount along with the information you initially entered for the Perks. We will do the matching ourselves at the end of the campaign.
- When Alpha is ready to be ship we will contact you to confirm the address. Should changes be required please advise us then.
Challenges in creating Alpha;
- Integrating the Artificial intelligent component with the hardware that will be future proof and upgradeable is our major hurdle and take times but with extra funding we can acquire additional resources we can eliminate this dilemma all together.
Battery Life:
Current Alpha using time until charge is around 2 hours. However by the time we reach the production stage we are aiming at doubling it. 
In the mean time we have designed a quick in quick out changeover battery system that enable to change your battery in a matter of minutes.
Connectivity:
Alpha is built-in with Bluetooth and Wifi capability as standard. Bluetooth connection can reach up to 200 feet in line of sign and 100 feet out of sight. As with Wifi typically 100-200 feet and more with repeaters. 
Unlike Bluetooth Wireless technology can also allow ALPHA to be control remotely from across the World making Alpha a security guard for patrolling your premises.
Waterproof or Splashproof:
Both. However waterproof are limited to only the height just below the deck.
